title: Engineering Manager
SUBCHEFE DE MÁQUINAS
description:
Job Purpose

• Works autonomously in all kin of projects, responsible for the safe and cost effective management of the vessel's plant and machinery, and must ensure that all measures are taken to prevent the pollution of the marine environment

Job Description

• Ensures that Class surveys are completed before their final due date• Issues Standing Orders to ensure safe and efficient operation of plant and equipment• Ensures the safe and efficient operation of all plant and machinery• Manages all maintenance tasks, the planned maintenance system, and unscheduled repairs that may be necessary on vessel plant and machinery• Orders stores and spare gear and maintains sufficient onboard stock levels• Assists in the planning of dry-dockings, major repairs, modifications, and surveys• Is the "Responsible Person" for all operations in the technical department requiring a work permit• Ensures that Class rules for safety, environmental protection, and the International Management Code for the Safe Operation of Ships and Pollution Prevention (ISM-International Safety Management) are strictly adhered to• Ensures that all vessel and third-party equipment under their responsibility is compliant where applicable

You are meant for this job if:

• Engineering degree• Unlimited Chief Engineer officer (Standards of Training, Certification and Watch-keeping (STCW) Reg III/2) Certificate of Competency• Competence in use of International Marine Contractors Association (IMCA) Guidelines for Design and Operation of Dynamically Positioned Vessels.• Appropriate safety related training specific to entity requirements

title: Quality Services Manager
description:
Job Purpose

Responsible for Service Quality in Brazil, including the Vitória unit and the Service activities in Açu and Rio de Janeiro, with headquarters in Macaé.

Leads Transformation of Quality Functions to achieve product and process quality requirements in alignment with customer requirements and applicable standards.  Establish Transformational and Continuous Improvement platforms and activities to achieve operational goals and objectives for Subsea Services.

Job Description

- Ensure Product and Process Quality are compliant with internal and customer requirements, and ensure alignment with API, ISO and other applicable industry standards.
- Responsible for implementing and maturing Management Systems at Subsea Services sites in collaboration with Subsea Services Center leaders and Site Leaders. Including but not limited to Purpose, Responsibilities, Routines, Metrics and Behaviors.
- Responsible for aligning and defining Site Quality Standards, and Responsible for achieving Quality Standards as well as identifying performance gaps for continuous improvement throughout the year and as input to the 3-year plan.
- Standardize, Simplify and Industrialize execution processes and activities, including digitization of data to enhance automation
- Implement modernized Competence Requirements of Quality employees by developing reports appropriately using the Competence Management System.
- Maintain strong relationships with strategic customers' quality representatives to report on the progress of problem handling
- Implement an effective system of corrective and preventive action to ensure the closure of non-conformities

You are meant for this job if:

• Engineering degree or equivalent work experience;

• Extensive experience working in industry; 
• Problem-solving and process improvement techniques such as Lean, Six Sigma, 8D, RCA and PFMEA; 
• Lean transformational leadership; 
• ISO 9001, API Q2; Inspection, audit and calibration processes; 
• Data analysis techniques; 
• Risk Management and Change Management; 
• Knowledge of maintenance, offshore services and engineering processes, as well as an understanding of manufacturing and welding processes;

• Knowledge of Digital, IDS and Opertaion Technology strategies
• Advanced English.

title: Vessel Operations Manager I (GJOB127004 | 13.2) 1
description:
Job Purpose

The VSO Deputy Vessel Manager supports the VSO Vessel Manager in overseeing a fleet of similar-type vessels. The primary objective is to ensure the delivery of safe, reliable, and cost-effective assets that meet customer requirements and expectations. This role involves managing a multi-disciplined team to maintain vessel systems integrity, marine integrity, and operational efficiency, ensuring the successful delivery of assets to the Business Units (BUs).

Job Description

  • To ensure that the fleet is ‘fit for purpose’ with respect to the Group’s subsea strategy and anticipated business opportunities
  • Responsible for improving the operational performance of the fleet (to optimise the number of days available) through the efficient management / oversight of Marine, Operations and Technical Services and the optimum use of Fleet Projects support
  • To ensure the efficient, timely and ‘on budget’ execution of maintenance projects affecting the availability of the assets, including both marine and asset systems maintenance
  • To liaise closely with ROV, Equipment and OPS departments to ensure the fleet has the equipment and personnel it needs to fulfil its obligations to the RBU’s
  • To collaborate with other VSO vessel managers with a view to optimising the number of people required to maintain and operate the VSO fleet
  • Working closely with New Projects and MNB to contribute to the specification of new vessels for the fleet, particularly those falling under VSO Vessel Manager’s specific asset type
  • Responsible for leading and managing the Asset Operations personnel with a view to enabling them to more efficiently and effectively discharge their responsibilities
  • To play a meaningful and valued role in the general management of the VSO Directorate, including the efficient and effective management of Regional Asset Operations activity – assisting and advising the VSO Director Vessel Execution where appropriate
  • Ensure assets are manned by competent crew, and that succession plans are established and in place for all offshore personnel designated to the assets under their control
  • To ensure that the vessels are maintained fit for purpose and consistently meet the requirements as set within the organisation
  • To ensure VSO Operations complies with all relevant UK and International legislation, in particular IMO/ISM, with respect to the Fleet and Offshore Operations
  • Recognise and drive the safety and environmental performance of the assets from within the Asset team
  • Proactive management of the vessel(s) P&L, including driving improvement opportunities
  • Maximise the availability and reliability of assigned assets
  • Optimise maintenance and critical spares of assigned assets and work collaboratively with BU for scheduling of such periods
  • Provide point of contact to BU PMT’s, or tendering teams, ensuring timely and accurate support and response to queries from a Vessel point of view
  • Provide point of contact to offshore management teams for operations management and support
  • Promote and develop a culture of continuous improvement within the team

You are meant for this job if:

Essential: 

  • Min. Degree Holder or Senior Marine Qualification (Unlimited Class 1 Master or Class 1 Chief Engineer)
  • Experience managing teams
  • Commercial and market understanding
  • Strong decision making and influencing skills
  • Strong planning and project management skills
  • Strong management and leadership skills
  • Ability to solve problems
  • Ability to communicate across multiple stakeholders in an international organization

 

Nice to have:

  • An operational background is preferred but is not deemed essential to the successful performance of the role

Additional Information

Required for position

  • Highly customer focussed
  • Self-motivated, and ability to manage teams and motivate others
  • Result orientated and completer/finisher – ability to consistently deliver on time and to budget
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Ability to empower people to take ownership for their responsibilities
  • Able to prioritise and work as part of a leadership team within a dynamic changing work environment
  • Development of SSI Activities pertaining to business excellence and continual improvement 

 

Required for future development

  • Desire to progress through management structure
  • Flexibility and willingness to take on responsibility in non ‘core experience’ areas

title: FEA engineer II 1 1
description:
Job Purpose

This is analysis engineer role and is based in Hyderabad. The role requires to perform FEA analysis of subsea production system and Surface Equipment products. Analyst creates, reviews and analyzes designs to ensure compliance to technical specifications, functionality and constructability.

Job Description

  • Review and interpret customer technical specifications and industry codes
  • Create and review technical documents (specifications, analysis reports etc.) for existing or new technology or applications.
  • Use sound engineering judgment, classical calculations and analysis programs to analyze designs and generate new designs.
  • Provide recommendations for optimizing designs to ensure functionality and manufacturability.
  • Independently develops solutions to problems by analyzing, interpreting and evaluating data.  Anticipates potential problems and takes preventative actions.
  • Responsible for quality and on-time-delivery of assigned tasks
  • Ensure good personal time management and weekly time entry into SAP system
  • Provide input to and support improvements to processes or work instructions
  • Ensure that assignments conform to TechnipFMC guidelines and specifications.
  • Understand and comply with TechnipFMC HSE & Quality policies

You are meant for this job if:

  • BE or MTech in Mechanical Engineering
  • Minimum 5+ years of relevant industry experience with background in analyzing subsea/surface equipment preferred
  • Ansys tool knowledge is must
  • Knowledge of industry specific design codes like ASME, API, DNV, NORSK and ISO
  • Experience in Oil and Gas equipment finite element analysis
  • Should be able to do hands-on Finite Element analysis
  • Experience in high pressurized equipment/Boiler vessels/Heavy Engineering
  • Must be able to verify and substantiate FEA results with classical hand calculation methods
  • Proficient in Non-Linear analysis
  • Proficient in Structural and Thermal analysis
  • Experience with welded and bolted structure analysis
  • Must be able to estimate, plan and meet individual work requirements
  • Should be able to perform technical design reviews and recommend improvements
  • Must be able to write, review and approve technical reports and documents
  • Ensure lessons learnt and best practices are captured adequately into Analysis techniques, project / product design.

title: Junior Designer
description:
Job Purpose

Join our teams as a Senior CAD Desiger.

You will be responsible for:

  • Perform 3D modeling (parametric models) and 2D drafting within schedule and with respect to Quality and Safety requirements related with design, field use, verification and testing of equipment.
  • Manage CAD tasks, ensure milestones completion and on time delivery, handle design/drafting packages, report on a continuous basis.
  • Develop detailed design drawings and specifications for mechanical equipment, using computer-assisted drafting (CAD) software.
  • Control proper BOM’s (Bill of Material) structure, perform Tolerance Stackup calculations for assemblies.
  • Coordinate with and consult other workers to design, lay-out, or detail components and systems and to resolve design or other problems.
  • Review and analyze specifications, sketches, drawings, ideas, and related data to assess factors affecting component designs and the procedures and instructions to be followed.

You are meant for this job if:

  • BA/MA degree in Engineering (preferably Mechanics, Machine Design, Mechanical Engineering)
  • Minimum 5+ years of experience in Product Design & Development using 3D CAD software (NX or Inventor preferred). 
  • Advanced English level (B2/C1) is required
  • Ability to read and interpret schematics, prints, mechanical drawings, and written technical information.
  • Very good knowledge on parametric design, arrangements/configurations, ASME/ISO drafting standards.
  • Good understanding of manufacturing and welding processes.
  • Experienced in GD&T (Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing) or GPS (Geometrical Product Specification).
  • Awarness of Tolerance Stack-up calculations for parts and assemblies.
  • Very good communication skills to discuss and explain technical information with all project stakeholders. Ability to work as a team member in the international environment.
  • Attention to detail, accuracy and thoroughness.

title: Real Estate & Facilities Management Relative Grade (GJRG051004 | 10.2)
description:
Job Purpose

This position reports to the Maintenance and Facilities Department. The primary function of this position is to maintain repairs and troubleshoots production machinery (e.g., CNC mills and lathes, hydraulic and pneumatic systems) and the facility infrastructure. The Technician is responsible for maintaining, troubleshooting and repairing or arranging for the repair of all building operating systems on the site.

Job Description

  • Responsible for all preventive maintenance, necessary maintenance and repairs to the buildings mechanical, electrical, HVAC, plumbing systems and to the production machinery or process equipment. This involves normal lubrication, adjustment, cleaning, replacement of consumable parts (such as filters, indicator lights, etc.), and periodic testing of the equipment.
  • Monitors mechanical, electrical, HVAC plumbing, life safety, fire protection and security systems to ensure proper operations and takes action or reports any conditions that are out of the ordinary.
  • Tasking includes repairing equipment or developing alternative solutions to present as repair options. In some cases, a creative solution must be implemented to keep production operational while the technically best or correct solution is found.
  • Uses preventative maintenance and work order software systems.
  • Performs all assigned work, to ensure the safety of the building’s tenants and the continuous operation of the site.
  • A major responsibility is to maintain a safe work environment for everyone on site.
  • Prioritizing work, finding efficient ways to accomplish tasks, and then communicating them are key to success

You are meant for this job if:

  • Works with minimal supervision and must be proactive.
  • High school education or GED required.
  • 3 - 5 years Industrial Maintenance
  • Familiar with and have working knowledge of building mechanical, electrical, HVAC, plumbing, life safety, fire protection and security systems
  • Familiar with and have working knowledge of process equipment (CNCs, HPUs, Presses, etc.)
  • Experience using power, pneumatic, hydraulic, and hand tools.
  • Experience using presses, overhead cranes, pressure gauges and precision measuring instruments.
  • Excellent trouble-shooting and communication skills, e.g., evaluating symptoms, determining root causes.
  • Proven ability to read and interpret data from charts, gauges, dials, blueprints, schematics, and technical manuals as needed when making adjustments, repairs or installations.
  • Ability to understand spoken and written instructions.
  • Able to make judgment calls with regards to necessity.
  • Proficient in basic computer applications and software.
  • Proven safety experience as to maintaining safe working conditions and safe work practices, e.g., lock-out/tag-out.
  • Ability to get familiar with and conforms to all written operating procedures associated with site.

WORK ENVIRONMENT: Shop environment with exposure to power machinery, heights, pressurized equipment, high noise levels, moving components, grease, dirt, sharp objects, LOTO, Confined space & Hot work. Works 40 hours per week. 
PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Numerous times daily, position requires standing, walking, climbing, bending, stooping, crawling and lifting of 30 - 50 pounds.

title: VSO Deputy Execution Manager (DOR)
description:
Job Purpose

The VSO Deputy Execution Manager is responsible for overseeing the execution of all project work scopes for a dedicated VSO asset, ensuring compliance with governance standards. This role involves managing a multi-disciplined team to deliver installation engineering and operations effectively and efficiently.

Job Description

  • Operational performance of dedicated allocated vessel during commercial operations, as per VSO governance
  • Standardise, simplify and industrialise offshore execution of project work scopes
  • Optimise dedicated vessel operations and project installation schedules
  • Reduce schedule contingencies and conservatism through use of robust normalised timings
  • Develop and maintain a culture of continuous improvement with a strong focus on HSE / Quality
  • Develop continuous improvement ecosystem through lessons learned and other data obtained
  • Development and monitoring of VSO and Asset performance KPI’s for the dedicated asset
  • Manage assigned resource forecasting for applicable VSO personnel, minimising under utilisation
  • Support the development of global VSO resource planning
  • Utilising global engineering centres to the benefit of the Group
  • Support the preparation of functional specifications for vessel upgrades and CAPEX requirements
  • Leverage the combined Execution streams to maximise the opportunity to improve performance and efficiency

You are meant for this job if:

  • Professional project management qualifications (desirable)
  • Experience managing and leading high performing teams
  • Commercial and market understanding
  • Effective decision making and influencing skills
  • Effective planning and project management skills

title: Project Controller 1
description:
Job Purpose

To meet new challenges and opportunities, we are seeking an efficient and structured Project Controller to join our Finance Department in Subsea Services at Ågotnes, Bergen.

 

As a Project Controller with us, you will be responsible, from quote to final accounts, for dedicated projects - based on frame agreements with our customer.

 

You will participate in project meetings and make decisions within the financial scope, together with Project Manager.

Responsibilities and Tasks

  • Invoicing according to Contract
  • Responsible for internal budgeting on projects, in accordance with internal procedures
  • Responsible for external budgeting/quotations, based on Frame Agreements
  • Create, maintain and close cost receiving accounts (network/WBS elements)
  • Prepare/review VORs (variation order requests) and CEUs (cost estimate updates), and follow up and report deviations from the budget
  • Tasks related to month-end-closing, such as: Ensure correct gross margin, follow up payments from customers, and report financial status - internally and externally
  • Participate in department meetings and project meetings

You are meant for this job if you have:

  • A Bachelor degree within Finance, or other relevant field
  • Experience from project controlling, with an understanding of cost control processes in projects
  • A high customer focus, are productive; with the drive to accomplish results
  • Accuracy, and good attention to detail
  • Good analytical and problem solving skills
  • Experience with identifying deviations from standards
  • The ability to recognize the impact of non-compliance with internal controls and accounting principles
  • High structure in your work day, meanwhile keeping a close dialog with your team
  • Good communication skills in; both in Norwegian and English
  • Knowledge of Office 365 and SAP (ERP system)

Your Future at TechnipFMC

We are an international company with great opportunities for internal growth:

  • Benefits like company cabins, in-house gym, and local social groups
  • You will be secured by good insurances and retirements plans through TechnipFMC
  • Enjoyable teamwork with colleagues from our on- & offshore-sites, as well as partners worldwide

 

For more information please contact Marita Åsgard Raae, Head of Controlling, Finance (+47 56154542)

 

We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Flow Operational Engineer
description:
We are looking for engineers who are are interested in Multidisciplinary understanding of production and operation and process control to our Asset Integrity & Production Management team at Lysaker, Norway.

You will be part of a service team for daily production and offshore campaigns in close interaction with operators. As part of our team, you will support online real time systems for Metering, Flow Assurance and Condition and Performance Monitoring.

This is a unique possibility to develop your technical skills and to get a a-z overview of the offshore operations.

Job Description

  • Actively follow up and maintain online multiphase flow advisory/assurance systems with focus on Multiphase pumping.
  • Regular monitoring of Condition of installed subsea basis including leakage detection and flow assurance criticalities.
  • Advice and review operational envelopes, system operability and operational settings.
  • Investigate operational and safety criticalities and establish troubleshooting test procedures.
  • Regular interaction with internal and external customers.
  • Engage with customer to understand their needs and bring feedback to product management and development.
  • Identify potential system improvements and how to achieve through multidiscipline teams.

You are meant for this job if:

  • Have a Master of Science degree typically within petroleum engineering, process engineering, fluid mechanics, applied mathematics, or Physics.
  • Knowledge of multiphase flow steady state and transient simulation (experience on using OLGA and HYSYS/Unisim is considered a plus), and willing to learn our engineering tool FlowManager Watch tool.
  • Are interested in production optimization and troubleshooting using high performance simulation software and online systems.
  • Have work experience within operation of oil & gas fields or subsea engineering.
  • You are interested in modern cloud technologies, data processing and machine learning
  • You have strong English and preferably Norwegian written and verbal communication skills.
  • You enjoy working in a high pace environment and can handle multiple tasks at the same time.
  • Graduates are encouraged to apply.

Your future at TechnipFMC

  • Your journey starts with our onboarding program.
  • You will get the possibility to attend several development activities.
  • We are an international company with great opportunities for internal growth.
  • We offer benefits, programs, and the possibility to work partially from home to support your Work-Life Balance.
  • We have benefits like company cabins, in-house gym, and local social groups.
  • You will be secured by good insurances and retirements plans through TechnipFMC.

Practicalities:

  • Location: Lysaker
  • Applications will be continuously evaluated. 
  • For more information, please contact Line Manager Tine Bauck Irmann-Jacobsen (+47 917 59 872).

title: Electronic Technician 1
description:
Job Purpose

Electronic Technician will support customers in planning, installing, monitoring, and maintaining control systems. The ET will perform preventative and corrective maintenance on all electronic related equipment.

Job Description

  • Ability to troubleshoot electronic circuits do the component level (resistor, capacitor, diode, IC etc.)
  • Ensure that all installations, repair, calibrations and modifications to the electrical systems and components are carried out in accordance with company policies and regulatory laws.
  • Maintain and repair electronic systems in relation to Surface equipment and drilling package instrumentation and electronics.
  • Carry out installation, calibration and modification to electronic systems and components as per TFMC maintenance standards.
  • Basic skills in soldering and assembling of electronic and electro/mechanical devices.
  • Proficient in the use of multi-meters, meggers, testers, and other basic testing and troubleshooting instruments.
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints, wiring diagrams, assembly prints, and parts lists.
  • General technical knowledge in fluid power technology, AC/DC circuits, and electro/mechanical devices.
  • Maintain workshop equipment/tools to the highest safety standards.
  • Perform daily visual inspections of equipment and prevent/rectify actual and potential malfunctions.
  • Responsible for creating an environment in which open communications occurs between departments, clients, and third parties as required.
  • Clearly and accurately communicate work status at end of shift and end of hitch handovers.

You are meant for this job if:

  • High school diploma or GED equivalent required.  Equivalent experience will be considered in lieu of education, if candidate successfully completes an aptitude and reading comprehension assessment in the pre-employment process.
  • 3+ years’ experience with electrical systems and maintenance
  • Experience with PLCs, SCRs, and MCCs
  • Self-driven, focused on customer service, with ability to work in a team environment.
  • Ability to travel to customer locations and perform work at off-site locations. Hours may vary based on customer demands, some overtime will be required. Valid driver’s license and must maintain satisfactory MVR in accordance with Company Fleet Policy
  • Demonstrated ability to read, write and speak English.
  • Demonstrates strong mechanical and technological aptitudes.
  • PC Skills with functional knowledge of MS Office products.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to develop creative solutions to optimize limited resources.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:  Outdoor weather conditions including cold, hot, wet, and humid conditions.   Requires working near moving mechanical parts. Occasional exposure to fumes, airborne particles, toxic/caustic chemicals. Minimal risk of electric shock.  Moderate to very loud noise levels. Appropriate PPE is provided and required.  

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:  Standing; Walking; Ability to talk and hear; Use of arms and hands to reach, manipulate with fingers, handle, feel and/or lift no more than 50lbs; Ability to climb, balance, stoop, crouch, crawl;  Ability to see close distance, long distance, identify and distinguish colors, observe an area that can be seen up and down or left and right while eyes are fixed on a given point (peripheral), judge distances and spatial relationships, three-dimensional vision (depth perceptions), ability to adjust and focus.  Appropriate PPE is provided and required.

title: Maintenance Technician II
description:
Job Purpose

This position reports to the Maintenance and Facilities Department. The primary function of this position is to maintain repairs and troubleshoots production machinery (e.g., CNC mills and lathes, hydraulic and pneumatic systems) and the facility infrastructure. The Technician is responsible for maintaining, troubleshooting and repairing or arranging for the repair of all building operating systems on the site.

Job Description

  • Responsible for all preventive maintenance, necessary maintenance and repairs to the buildings mechanical, electrical, HVAC, plumbing systems and to the production machinery or process equipment. This involves normal lubrication, adjustment, cleaning, replacement of consumable parts (such as filters, indicator lights, etc.), and periodic testing of the equipment.
  • Monitors mechanical, electrical, HVAC plumbing, life safety, fire protection and security systems to ensure proper operations and takes action or reports any conditions that are out of the ordinary.
  • Tasking includes repairing equipment or developing alternative solutions to present as repair options. In some cases, a creative solution must be implemented to keep production operational while the technically best or correct solution is found.
  • Uses preventative maintenance and work order software systems.
  • Performs all assigned work, to ensure the safety of the building’s tenants and the continuous operation of the site.
  • A major responsibility is to maintain a safe work environment for everyone on site.
  • Prioritizing work, finding efficient ways to accomplish tasks, and then communicating them are key to success

You are meant for this job if:

  • Works with minimal supervision and must be proactive.
  • High school education or GED required.
  • 3 - 5 years Industrial Maintenance
  • Familiar with and have working knowledge of building mechanical, electrical, HVAC, plumbing, life safety, fire protection and security systems
  • Familiar with and have working knowledge of process equipment (CNCs, HPUs, Presses, etc.)
  • Experience using power, pneumatic, hydraulic, and hand tools.
  • Experience using presses, overhead cranes, pressure gauges and precision measuring instruments.
  • Excellent trouble-shooting and communication skills, e.g., evaluating symptoms, determining root causes.
  • Proven ability to read and interpret data from charts, gauges, dials, blueprints, schematics, and technical manuals as needed when making adjustments, repairs or installations.
  • Ability to understand spoken and written instructions.
  • Able to make judgment calls with regards to necessity.
  • Proficient in basic computer applications and software.
  • Proven safety experience as to maintaining safe working conditions and safe work practices, e.g., lock-out/tag-out.
  • Ability to get familiar with and conforms to all written operating procedures associated with site.

WORK ENVIRONMENT: Shop environment with exposure to power machinery, heights, pressurized equipment, high noise levels, moving components, grease, dirt, sharp objects, LOTO, Confined space & Hot work. Works 40 hours per week. 
PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Numerous times daily, position requires standing, walking, climbing, bending, stooping, crawling and lifting of 30 - 50 pounds.

title: Production Supervisor
description:

Grunnet fratredelse er vi nå på utkikk etter en arbeidende Supervisor for å lede MMR aktivitetene på e-Solution produktene i verkstedet på Kongsberg. Aktivitetene vil i all hovedsak foregå på Kongsberg.

Arbeidsoppgaver:

  • Fordele å prioritere jobber på tvers av alle prosjekter
  • Være kontaktperson for produksjonsrelaterte spørsmål for e-Solution produkter
  • Bidra til balansering av kapasitet i verkstedet
  • Ansvarlig for den daglige praktiske oppfølging av medarbeiderne i avdelingen
  • Jobbe aktivt for tilrettelegging av arbeidsplasser og utstyr
  • Jobbe aktivt med å få til et godt samarbeid mellom Engineering og Produksjon
  • Bistå med montasje og test
  • Utarbeide planer i samsvar med produksjonsplanlegger for alle pågående og kommende ordrer
  • Ansvarlig for at relevante risikoanalyser er på plass og oppdatert
  • Forbedre arbeidsprosesser

  • Delta på Kvalitet og HMS auditer
  •  Aktivt jobbe for å forbedre HMS på arbeidsplassen
  • Aktivt bidra til forbedringer av Lean og 5S systemet for å oppnå en effektiv produksjon

Krav til kompetanse:

title: Project Assistant
description:
Job Purpose

In OneServices Tooling we focus on increasing re-use & sharing of tools globally, ensuring tooling integrity and executing flawlessly.

We are looking for a Project Assistant with leadership to deliver to commitments, Lean mindset to drive continuous improvements and preferably experienced with workover and installation tooling. We want the Project Assistant to become a Project Manager in the future.
This is the position for you if you enjoy working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment together with our colleagues in Commercial, Projects, Service Centers, Engineering, and Sourcing where we define and deliver cost-winning solutions. 

Job Description

  •  Actively support the Project Managers for OneServices Tooling deliverables
  • Manage small projects, such as the overhaul of equipment in the workshop or at a supplier.
  • Collaborate with the Project Manager to initiate all necessary actions to ensure that the project is completed on schedule and in accordance with all contract requirements.
  • Ensure that subcontractor evaluation, selection, and management are conducted in accordance with established procedures.
  • Promote an HSE and quality mindset, as well as commercial awareness.
  • Work with technical management within OneServices Tooling to develop technical and functional solutions to achieve strategic objectives.

  • Ability to lead/support conflict management

  • Flexible with regards to traveling as part of the project execution/follow-up (globally)

Your future at TechnipFMC:

  • We offer benefits, programs and the possibility to work partially from home to support your Work-Life Balance

title: Junior Design Engineer
description:
Job Description

  • Designing subsea equipment for oil & gas industry from concept phase through releasing it for manufacturing & providing life of field support.
  • Designing products in accordance with design specifications and engineering standards.
  • Reviewing machinery designs.
  • Cooperating within the assigned project team and other cross-functions teams.
  • Taking responsibility for product documentation required for procurement, fabrication, testing including:
  • ▸Product quality requirements,
  • ▸3D models, drawings and layouts of single components, assemblies & systems,
  • ▸Verification of design using classical analysis techniques and/or FEA,
  • ▸Assembly, test & maintenance documentation,
  • ▸Creating & maintenance of user/engineering/service documentation,
  • Performing Product Design Reviews.
  • Executing work in order to deliver the design in compliance with requirements, within baseline dates and budgets.
  • Participating in technical meetings with Customers and Suppliers.
  • Defining assembly and test requirements.

You are meant for this job if:

  • BA/MA degree in Engineering (preferably Mechanics, Machine Design, Mechanical Engineering or similar).
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in Product Design & Development.
  • Good communication skills to discuss aspects of the design with stakeholders and lead design reviews.
  • Ability to work in challenging project environment, problem solving skills, accountability.
  • Experience in CAD software (creating models, drawings, assemblies, geometric dimensioning and tolerancing).
  • Knowledge of manufacturing processes.
  • Fluent English & Polish.

title: Workshop Service Technician I
description:
Job Purpose

This position is an entry level position with the focus on learning and application of skills. This position assembles and tests mechanical assemblies of low complexity.  Also, assembly technicians at this level continue to train on more advanced/complex assemblies.
 

Job Description

  • Assembles and tests assemblies according to TFMC specifications.  Applies and develops basic skills in procedures, techniques, tools, materials and/or equipment.
  • Completes required test documentation including test reports, failed test reports and Non-Conformance Reports (NCR).
  • Cleans components after assembly according to TFMC specifications and verbal/written instructions.
  • Inputs labor details into Labor Tracking System (LTS) for cost tracking purposes.
  • Uses material handling equipment to move parts and components from one work or storage area to another as required.
  • Performs all duties in a safe manner and keeps all employees aware of dangers in work area.  Practices good housekeeping in work area.
  • Learns procedures and practices safety to prepare for next level.
  • Assists other Assembly Technicians as assigned in more advanced functions as part of training.

You are meant for this job if:

  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Clear understanding of general math & can read, write & comprehend English.  Ability to comprehend engineering and weld blueprints.  
  • Ability to use personal computer and/or workstation.
  • Typically, no experience in related field, but demonstrates mechanical aptitude.
  • Must pass all classroom and hands-on testing per “Assembly Training Program.”
  • Basic English written and communication skills.
  • Ability to operate high torque wrenches, overhead cranes, jib cranes, forklifts, and rigging.   Ability to use hand tools, power tools and measuring devices such as tapes, rulers and pressure gauges.

Senior Process Specialist Engineer: Depending on local context, the denomination “specialist” refers to specializations such as thermal rating, dynamic simulation, materials and corrosion, knowledge management, CFD modeling etc.

title: OPERADOR TRAINEE ROV
description:
Job Purpose

The Pipelay Operator I is responsible for the safe and efficient operation of vessel pipelay equipment and for carrying out additional maintenance or administrative duties as directed by Pipelay Systems Supervisor (PSS) or Chief Pipelay Engineer (CPE).

Job Description

"• Operation of the pipelay system and other equipment / machinery as directed by relevant Project and Pipelay System personnel, for all Project and Maintenance activities• Attend and assist to all Project or internal safety briefings, ‘Safe Job Analysis’, and toolbox safety meetings• Assist and monitor all pipelay equipment parameters supplied by the Project Team and approved by CPE, OCM, Senior Project Engineer and Barge Engineer• Understand and comply with all Company procedures, policies and instructions, and the TMOS Business Management System• Be familiar with project specific work scope and procedures• Be fully conversant with system layout, operation modes, failures and alarms• Maintain a clear and accurate log of all activities and times undertaken during Project execution• Report immediately all system faults to the PSS or CPE and notify the Offshore Construction Manager (OCM) or Assistant Offshore Construction Manager (AOCM), maintaining a clear and accurate log of all times, faults and solutions• Maintain accuracy of Logs, Shift Changeover Reports and other Reports while ensuring correct filing of all paperwork• Using Operator and Control screens, ensure all pipelay equipment is available in advance of requirement and confirmed to be running and checked out by relevant personnel• Maintain all pipelay system control spaces in a clean and tidy state• Work in a 12-hour shift pattern with other Pipelay Operators such that only one Operator is relieved at a time. During this relief, a comprehensive handover is completed between oncoming and off going personnel, prior to receipt of shift responsibility by oncoming Operator"

title: ENGENHEIRO HSE JR
description:
Job Purpose

Apoiar o departamento de Saúde, Segurança e Meio Ambiente (HSE) da empresa em suas atividades cotidianas, visando garantir a segurança e a saúde dos trabalhadores e preservar o meio ambiente em que a empresa opera, auxiliando no cumprimento dos compromissos estabelecidos na política de HSE.

Job Description

 - Apoiar as atividades operacionais e contribuir para que atendam os requisitos de segurança do trabalho e meio ambiente (Atuar em projetos offshore, docagens/manutenções e port calls, Gestão HSE de subcontratados, Realizar auditorias internas e em fornecedores, Realizar auditorias internas de sistemas de gestão da HSE, Orientar e monitorar os Técnicos HSE Offshore). 
 - Acompanhar as mudanças nas regulamentações de Segurança do Trabalho e avaliar seu impacto nas atividades da Empresa;
 - Participar representando a empresa em auditorias externas de HSE de instalações offshore;
 - Utilizar as ferramentas de HSE com objetivo de reduz a exposição de colaboradores a situações de risco e atuar como portavoz dos processos e ferramentas de HSE nas instalações offshore;
 - Participar de processo de identificação de riscos ocupacionais e de acidentes;
 - Realizar inspeções para avaliação da integridade de equipamentos e instalações no atendimento a requisitos de HSE;
 - Ministrar treinamentos técnicos e promover campanhas relacionados a HSE;

- Entre outras atividades.

You are meant for this job if:

Formação em Engenharia com Pós-graduação em Engenharia de Segurança do Trabalho;

Vivência como Engenheiro de Segurança do Trabalho preferencialmente em empresas do segmento de óleo e gás;

Experiência em atuar com diferentes partes interessadas (projeto, cliente, parceiro), especialmente Petrobras;

Desejável experiência em  projetos com PLSVs / Instalações de linhas flexíveis;

Conhecimento de legislação marítima (SOLAS, NORMAM, MARPOL), e forte em Sistema de Gestão de HSE e em ferramentas do Office 365.

Inglês Intermediário.

Job Description: Support operational activities and contribute to their compliance with occupational safety and environmental requirements (Work on offshore projects, dry docking/maintenance, and port calls; Manage HSE of subcontractors; Conduct internal and supplier audits; Conduct internal audits of HSE management systems; Guide and monitor Offshore HSE Technicians). - Monitor changes in Occupational Safety regulations and assess their impact on the company's activities; - Represent the company in external HSE audits of offshore facilities; - Utilize HSE tools to reduce employee exposure to risk situations and act as a spokesperson for HSE processes and tools at offshore facilities; - Participate in the process of identifying occupational risks and accidents; - Conduct inspections to assess the integrity of equipment and facilities in compliance with HSE requirements; - Provide technical training and promote campaigns related to HSE; - Among other activities. You are meant for this job if: Engineering degree with a postgraduate degree in Occupational Safety Engineering; Experience as an Occupational Safety Engineer, preferably in companies in the oil and gas segment; Experience in working with different stakeholders (project, client, partner), especially Petrobras; Desirable experience in projects with PLSVs / Flexible Line Installations; Knowledge of maritime legislation (SOLAS, NORMAM, MARPOL), and strong in HSE Management System and Office 365 tools. Intermediate English.

title: Tender Lead
description:
Job Purpose

As a Tender Lead within the Subsea Tender Team, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the Tender Project Manager and Prospect Account Manager throughout the commercial process of allocated tenders and prospects. Your primary responsibility is to ensure the Subsea Tender Team’s strict adherence to the Subsea Commercial Operating Manual and Bid It Standard, thereby contributing to the successful and compliant execution of tender projects.

Key Responsibilities

General:

  • Contributing to the achievement of the Commercial Order Intake targets, as a key member of any Subsea Tender Team.
  • Supports Tender Project Manager and Prospect Account Manager throughout the tender process, specifically through responsibility for Subsea Tender Team adherence to Subsea Commercial Operating Manual and Bid It Standard for allocated prospects. 
  • Mentors, directs, and oversees less experienced Tendering personnel allocated to prospects. Oversees all commercial activities during tender life cycle from receipt of tender, through to contract award and subsequent handover to the execution team.
  • Provides support to Prospect Account Manager and Tender Project Manager on key tender decision-making processes, by overseeing decision input data collation.
  • Contribute directly to value creation and commercial gain to TechnipFMC and Clients for allocated prospects. 
  • Support value destruction investigation and participate in improvement initiatives associated with improving tender output in execution phase. 
  • As a key member of the Tendering function, actively participate and lead weekly Tendering Team meetings and lead follow up of subsequent actions allocated.
  • Support and provide input to Tendering function resource forecasting.
  • Maintain the appropriate level of industry networking to ensure the Tendering team understands the latest industry commercial and contractual advances and developments, advising how TechnipFMC can maximize its position. 
  • Identify changes to internal / external environment and implications for the business. Implement appropriate actions and roll out to the Tendering team, and wider population, where appropriate. 
  • Support Tender Project Manager and Prospect Account Manager with internal interfaces / relationships, ensuring clear lines of delineation between departments, and the effective award of allocated prospect. 
  • Champion ongoing maintenance and continued development of tendering documentation and systems through utlisation of digital/software deployment, examples being iQuEst and XaitPorter.
  • Other appropriate tasks as may be directed by Commercial and Tendering Directors from time to time.

 

Tender Phase (Post Invest):

  • Oversees the compilation by allocated Subsea Tender Team members of cost base, C-AFE preparation, commercial models, cashflow, commercial qualifications/clarifications, compensation and tender submission documentation ensuring that the proposal meets both client and management expectations.
  • Liaise with legal on contractual qualifications, including provision of data to support commercial decisions where applicable.

 

Post Tender Submit Phase:

  • Post tender submission, oversees compilation of responses to customer clarifications, contract drafting and continued adherence to Subsea Commercial Operating Manual and Bid It Standard, ensuring successful execution of tender process and securing of prospects, for subsequent handover to Project Execution Team. 
  • Participate and lead or support contract negotiations from a Commercial perspective with attendance at client meetings. Requirement to lead such meetings is subject to experience of Subsea Tender Team members.  
     

You are meant for this job if:

  • Previous experience in performing any of the following roles: Senior Tendering/Proposals/Commercial Engineer, Tender/Proposals/Commercial Lead, demonstrating exposure to key commercial concepts in relation to tendering activities. 
  • High standard of written and spoken English.
  • Ability to communicate with all levels and disciplines within the business.
  • Ability to work under minimal supervision and direction.
  • Able to work within and contribute to a motivated and professional environment.
  • Self-motivated and persistent. 
  • Ability to mentor and develop junior colleagues.
  • Professional or degree level qualification in Engineering, Quantity Surveying, Business or Legal discipline.
  • Detailed knowledge of the Subsea Offshore Industry.
  • Outline knowledge of TechnipFMC products and services.

Personal Qualities

  • Exhibits leadership qualities & interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to understand and deliver tender strategy with minimal direction.
  • Experience of collaboration and working collectively with peers.
  • Ability to proactively challenge, develop and promote solutions.
  • Ability to coordinate / interface with senior management.
  • Effective delegation & coordination of diverse teams.
  • Ability and willingness to develop others.
  • Strong focus on prioritisation & effective delivery.
  • Demonstrates strong commitment to compliance.

title: Subsea Controls Engineer, SPS Services
description:
Job Purpose

To provide first line controls support for our clients' offshore operations.

Job Description

The available position is for a subsea controls engineer working offshore on a rotational basis to support our clients' operations in Indonesia.

Specifically, the role entails performing daily monitoring, troubleshooting and maintenance of the topside and subsea controls system.

Daily and monthly progress reporting are a requirement of the job as well as keeping in close contact with the regional TechnipFMC subsea services team.

The role is on a 4-weeks rotational basis and when not offshore the engineer will support other fields in the region.

As part of the role, the candidate is expected to be able to perform hands-on troubleshooting and maintenance of equipment

You are meant for this job if:

Bachelor's degree in Controls & Automation or equivalent with minimum 2 years offshore experience 

Experience in operating TechnipFMC or other vendors topside and subsea controls systems

Experience in operating SPCU/EPU, MCS/SCU, HPU, Safety Systems, SCADA, PLC and DCS. 

Knowledge and understanding of subsea instrumentation and controls

Understanding of topside and subsea networks, basic network troubleshooting.

Good communication skills (in both verbal and written English for progress reporting and engineering procedure writing)

Service oriented

title: Principal Materials Engineer 1 1
description:
Job Purpose

The Principal Engineer in the Metallics Materials Fabrication and Centre of Expertise (COE) will be responsible for leading research and development initiatives, with a strong focus on Simplification, Standardisation, and Industrialisation (SSI) of metallic materials and fabrication processes. This role will support various projects across TechnipFMC, ensuring the highest standards of quality, efficiency, and innovation. The Principal Engineer will also provide world-class customer support to both internal and external stakeholders.

Job Description

  • Lead and manage research and development projects to advance metallic materials and fabrication technologies.
  • Drive initiatives focused on Simplification, Standardisation, and Industrialisation (SSI) of materials and processes.
  • Lead product development and qualification efforts.
  • Oversee supplier qualification and industrialisation processes.
  • Conduct technical audits to ensure compliance with industry standards and internal requirements.
  • Provide technical support and guidance to project teams on material selection, fabrication techniques, and quality control.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment of material and fabrication strategies with project goals.
  • Develop and maintain technical documentation, including specifications, procedures, and reports.
  • Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.
  • Mentor and train junior engineers and technicians.
  • Stay updated with the latest advancements in materials science and fabrication technologies.
  • Support the life cycle of all products and systems, applying expertise in materials science, metallurgy, welding, and NDT.
  • Participate in strategic global planning for the materials discipline to ensure consistent availability of competent resources.
  • Engage in technical negotiations with clients and suppliers as needed.
  • Provide input for the development of R&D proposal for future activities;
  • Participate in product and process development activities, particularly where related to pipe / new pipe materials, and identify new/key pipe product & materials opportunities for the Group.

You are meant for this job if:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Materials Science, Metallurgical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field.
  • Vast amount of experience in metallic materials and fabrication processes.
  • Strong knowledge of material properties, testing methods, and fabrication techniques.
  • Experience with industry standards and regulations related to metallic materials and fabrication.
  • Proven track record in leading R&D projects and driving SSI initiatives.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
  • Understanding of the full delivery scope (SURF, SPS, and Services) of iEPCI projects.

title: Finance Operations Business Partner, NAM Subsea Services
description:
Job Purpose

The Finance Operations Business Partner will provide strategic financial support and leadership within the North America subsea services division. This role is integral in driving financial performance, ensuring compliance, and offering insights through financial analysis. The successful candidate will collaborate closely with the Vice President Subsea Services USA and Canada and his/her Leadership Teams to ensure financial objectives are met efficiently. This position is currently reporting to Virginie Charrier but will eventually report to the Finance Operations Director.

  • Prepare financial forecasts, budgets, and performance analyses.
  • Lead the annual budgeting process and provide updates on variances.
  • Support financial decision-making and review project expenditures.
  • Prepare accurate financial reports and support audits.
  • Ensure compliance with financial standards and manage costs.
  • Build strong relationships with finance and operational teams.
  • Drive process improvements and stay updated on best practices.

You are meant for this job if:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, or related field
  • Basic knowledge of US GAAP rules and regulations
  • Strong accounting and finance process knowledge
  • Project management skills and ERP system knowledge (SAP, GEOS)
  • Ability to work independently and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment

title: SUPERV OPERACOES BASE VITORIA
description:
Missão do cargo

• Supervisionar e executar atividades de desenvolvimento de competências operacionais e técnicas do time de Operações, baseando-se nas políticas e regras da Empresa e mais particularmente nos procedimentos e instruções de trabalho do próprio departamento. Supervisionar e desenvolver os programas de treinamento aplicáveis aos membros das equipes de operações.

Descrição do Cargo

Promover o uso das ferramentas de HSE, disseminando as boas práticas de segurança em favor dos membros do time das operações e demais colaboradores da empresa. 

Sugerir a implantação de melhorias do desenvolvimento de competências das equipes, observando os aspectos de Produtividade, Qualidade e HSE.

Garantir o cumprimento das rotinas administrativas de RH, funcionando como um elo entre estes departamentos. Prestar suporte ao time Gerencial de Operações nos aspectos administrativos e técnicos de desenvolvimento de competências dentro dos departamentos 

Suportar as atividades operacionais, participando de novas contratações, identificando necessidade de treinamentos e ajudando na avaliação das equipes operacionais por meio do programa de Avaliação de Desempenho da Empresa.

Promover entre os membros da equipe de Operações as Políticas de Qualidade, Saúde, Segurança e Meio Ambiente da Empresa bem como atuar diretamente nas auditorias de certificação de tais políticas. 

Auxiliar a gerência dos departamentos operacionais na gestão dos prazos e demandas de responsabilidade dos departamentos operacionais. 

Atuar ativamente no desenvolvimento dos colaboradores das operações através da reciclagem de treinamentos para inserção de novas tecnologias ou melhorias associadas. 

Atuar diretamente nos testes diversos nos processos operacionais, estabelecendo ao fim, relatórios técnicos sob a ótica do desenvolvimento das equipes acerca do que foi testado. 

Promover o intercâmbio de informações técnicas entre as outras unidades de manufatura do grupo, com o objetivo de compartilhar problemas, soluções e novos desenvolvimentos, principalmente focado no desenvolvimento de competências do time operacional.

Participar ativamente das reuniões de planejamento de base, Operacionais ou qualquer reunião correlata.

title: Senior Design Engineer 1
description:
Your Responsibilities

You will be part of an Installation & Intervention group developing products and services from concept to operations and work closely with our Service Centers to improve continuously.

title: Director of Accounting Africa
description:
Job Purpose

The Accounting Director is responsible for overseeing the accounting function for TFMC’s Africa and Portuguese entities This role will manage the Accounting Operations including AP, AR and GL, Internal Controls and Compliance of these entities while ensuring together with the local Accounting Teams that Accounting activities are performed conform to TechnipFMC’s policies, US GAAP, and local legal and regulatory requirements.

Job Description

  • Lead and manage the Accounting Teams- Responsible for managing a global team across cultures with, in person and regular remote interaction within the Accounting group to ensure proper preparation, interpretation and analyzing of financial data, financial transactions, and events
  • Collaborate with global and regional cross-functional leaders to transform and improve quality of processes leveraging technology and process simplification ahead of our OneERP program. Will be responsible for developing and implementing new systems to improve efficiency, timeliness, and accuracy of accounting operations through SSI initiatives.
  • Ability to manage competing priorities to deliver deliverables on time and in a quality manner. Specifically, ensuring the Region contributes to an accurate and timely monthly, quarterly, and year end close.
  • Responsible for delivery of process based Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for the Region and will work closely with business unit controllers to provide timely and accurate information for the preparation of financial statements.
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders at all levels inclusive of senior leadership.

  • Promote a lean culture and environment where teams are encouraged to continuously learn, improve processes, solve problems and develop skills.

You are meant for this job if:

title: Workshop Service Technician I
description:
Job Purpose

This position is an entry level position with the focus on learning and application of skills. This position assembles and tests mechanical assemblies of low complexity.  Also, assembly technicians at this level continue to train on more advanced/complex assemblies.
 

Job Description

  • Assembles and tests assemblies according to TFMC specifications.  Applies and develops basic skills in procedures, techniques, tools, materials and/or equipment.
  • Completes required test documentation including test reports, failed test reports and Non-Conformance Reports (NCR).
  • Cleans components after assembly according to TFMC specifications and verbal/written instructions.
  • Inputs labor details into Labor Tracking System (LTS) for cost tracking purposes.
  • Uses material handling equipment to move parts and components from one work or storage area to another as required.
  • Performs all duties in a safe manner and keeps all employees aware of dangers in work area.  Practices good housekeeping in work area.
  • Learns procedures and practices safety to prepare for next level.
  • Assists other Assembly Technicians as assigned in more advanced functions as part of training.

You are meant for this job if:

  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Clear understanding of general math & can read, write & comprehend English.  Ability to comprehend engineering and weld blueprints.  
  • Ability to use personal computer and/or workstation.
  • Typically, no experience in related field, but demonstrates mechanical aptitude.
  • Must pass all classroom and hands-on testing per “Assembly Training Program.”
  • Basic English written and communication skills.
  • Ability to operate high torque wrenches, overhead cranes, jib cranes, forklifts, and rigging.   Ability to use hand tools, power tools and measuring devices such as tapes, rulers and pressure gauges.

title: Program Training Manager
description:
Job Purpose

This position directly supports the content and implementation of operational training aspects within Subsea Services NAM, focusing on Operations Technicians and supporting roles. The Program Training Manager will assist in implementing learning solutions aligned with the organization’s immediate needs and standards. The incumbent will help develop processes and procedures to organize, coordinate, manage, and evaluate training and competency objectives efficiently.

By supporting the development and retention of technical talents within the Subsea Services organization, the Program Training Manager contributes to enhancing overall SQDC performance and fostering a culture of continuous learning.

Job Description

As the Program Training Manager, you will be part of the Operations team, reporting to the Business System Operations Manager and working with Learning & Knowledge Management (LKM). Your main focus will be to support the technical workforce by identifying training needs, coordinating training programs, and ensuring successful implementation of development initiatives. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, subject matter experts, and external training providers to create a comprehensive training framework. Your efforts will enhance employee skills, improve operational efficiency, and foster a culture of excellence and innovation within the Subsea Services department.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Create engaging training materials (presentations, e-learning modules, instructional guides, multimedia content) for effective knowledge transfer and skill development.
  • Implement various training methodologies (classroom, on-the-job, workshops, simulations, mentorship) to maximize learning outcomes.
  • Collaborate with subject matter experts, internal stakeholders, and external vendors for training delivery and content development.
  • Stay updated with industry trends and best practices to incorporate relevant innovations into the training framework.

Secondary Responsibilities:

  • Design and develop tailored training programs based on the specific needs of technicians and technical personnel.
  • Support the full lifecycle of training programs (onboarding, initial training, competency evaluations, recurring training, sustainable competency management, compliance with TechnipFMC, customer, and industry requirements).
  • Conduct training needs assessments with departmental managers and supervisors to identify skill gaps and areas for improvement.
  • Work with the LKM Team to leverage existing training resources and best practices for a cohesive approach to talent development and knowledge sharing.
  • Evaluate the effectiveness of training initiatives through assessments, surveys, and feedback, and continuously improve programs based on results.
  • Develop and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics to evaluate the impact of training initiatives, aligning learning outcomes with business objectives.

You are meant for this job if:

Required:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.
  • 2+ years of experience in a technical field (e.g., engineering, operations).
  • Understanding of training needs, analysis, and instructional design principles.
  • Strong organizational and project management skills to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and manage multiple training projects.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills to convey technical concepts clearly.
  • Collaborative and adaptable team player capable of building positive working relationships and influencing cross-functionality at all levels.
  • Passion for learning and professional development, staying updated with industry trends and innovations.
  • Problem-solving skills with an analytical, data-driven mindset.
  • Service-oriented mindset.

Advantage:

  • Previous experience in a Subsea Services role.
  • Experience in training and development.
  • Experience in developing and implementing technical training programs, preferably in technical disciplines.
  • Familiarity with learning management systems (iLearn, Kahuna).
  • Relevant certifications in training and development or related fields.

title: Manager, Graduate Engineering Program
description:
Job Purpose

The One Engineering Global Graduate Program (GGP) is a strategic development program created to recruit talent, develop technical skills, provide work experience, and effectively prepare our engineering graduates for placement into various engineering disciplines. Program is strategically designed to support engineering business needs with a valuable talent pipeline.    All new hire graduates enter the company through the program and reside here for the initial phase of their career.

There are three (3) primary aspects of the Engineering Graduate Program:

  • Development through a rotational work assignment, training experience, and individual mentoring to acquire the required skills, competencies, and knowledge for success.   
  • Engagement via dedicated induction, social interaction, building personal networking, and group project execution. Visibility to our organization leadership and global population to understand our products, services, market, and culture.
  • Retention through performance feedback, peer networking, career planning, and aligned compensation practices. Enable organizational placement for suitable engineering roles.

The Graduate Engineering Manager is the line manager for graduates. They will oversee all aspects of the program at the local site and ensure alignment with a global program peer network.   Manager directly interacts with graduates, supervisors, managers, mentors, and business points of contact and is accountable to internal stakeholders for program success.

Job Description

Manage the Graduate Program at country level in its three aspects: development, engagement, and retention. Ensure program principles are consistently followed.

 

Perform line manager responsibilities – Candidate hiring selection, onboarding activities, basic training coordination, selection of rotational assignments for graduate, and collection of performance feedback. These activities include HR web administration, compensation, PTO, expenses, asset management, and relevant work environment support. Reporting to global program manager.

 

Regularly interact with local engineering managers to establish strategic rotational assignments that support the global graduate program. Rotations purposely derived for graduate development, company engagement, and result in the desired company retention. Rotations will strive to include available disciplines which support cross-functional capabilities and talent exchange across disciplines.

 

Implement and monitor graduate program guidelines, objectives, and budget at country level. Focal point for country implementation and sustainable program. Participation in global peer network. Maintain resource staffing plans in accordance with program headcount definitions. Obtain forecasts, reconcile planning, and ensure the flow through the program into local engineering teams.  

 

Report-out quarterly to stakeholders to ensure alignment between company strategy and program execution.  Hold internal stakeholders accountable to program commitments. Establish and promote internal networks that add value to graduate development, retention, and resources while active in the program. Enable opportunities for future career growth.

 

Collaborate with other Graduate Program Managers – Develop program materials, share experiences, support achieving global targets, and enable opportunities to connect graduates globally.

Additional Description

Liaise with business to ensure all graduates are successfully transitioned out of the program. Actively support strategic placement within the business units in alignment with Talent Management processes as applicable. Facilitate graduate preferences with compatible hiring manager resource needs.

 

Uphold relationships with the target universities and key industry groups to strengthen TechnipFMC brand and continually improved pipeline of talent being recruited. Where applicable, ensure all direct reports and office environments adhere to all corporate, HSE, and department trainings.

 

Support the program attraction of targeted talent through close collaboration with P&C Recruiting team, Communications, TechnipFMC targeted universities, and business stakeholders. Support combined strategies for internship and apprenticeship programs to the Graduates Program, ensuring talent pipeline is overseen in an integrated way.

You are meant for this job if:

6+ years of professional experience including experience in a leadership or supervisory role

Bachelor’s degree

Proven management and team leadership skills

Excellent communication, organization, time management, and planning skills

Excellent interpersonal, intercultural awareness, and stakeholder management skills

Strong ability to network both internally and externally.

Experience in employee performance coaching and mentoring

Working knowledge of business departments throughout the company

title: Supplier Quality Engineer 1
description:
Introduction to the job:

We are seeking for a Supplier Quality Engineer that can support our projects in planning and execution of quality risk mitigation activities with special focus on piping, plastic, welding, forging and tubing products and has experience from Subsea Projects.

Job Description

  • In the role of Supplier Quality Engineer your main tasks will be:
    • Collaborate in planning of Quality Surveillance activities for the project to ensure that suppliers meet the requirements
    • Participate in Package Criticality Assessments and Supplier Risk Assessments
    • Be responsible for preparing the Quality Surveillance plans
    • Participate in Pre-Production Meetings, weekly meetings with project team and other stakeholders
    • Manage the suppliers intervention activities, review and follow up inspection and test plans in accordance with the project QS plan
    • Responsible for follow up Supplier NCRs, RCCAs, status reporting of supplier performance and lessons learned
    • Interacts with SQEs on Corrective Actions and preventive development of the suppliers to mitigate risk to the Project
    • Review Inspection reports and ensure that they are stored and followed up.
    • Participating in defining the content of the SMDR to ensure that each product will get the correct documents / procedures / reports that will cover the manufacturing process
    • Support QHSE onsite activities through QCS/SQ function where needed
    • Participate in suppliers’ performance assessment
  • The Supplier Quality Control and Surveillance Engineer will be reporting to the Supplier Quality Manager and be part of European Supplier Quality Team
  • The position will be remunerational in accordance with TechnipFMC position grading system which is competitive with the marked
  • The position is located in the TechnipFMC Lysaker office, but travelling (estimated 25%) will be required within Norway and Europe for Surveillance activities towards Suppliers

You are meant for this job if:

  • A Bachelor’s Degree or similar required
  • Minimum 3 years experience in Quality, Engineering, Supplier Development, Supplier Quality and/or Project Management
  • Experience with auditing of Quality and HSE Management Systems
  • Additional experience in Supply Chain management, Lean Manufacturing, Process Improvement is desired
  • Work experience can compensate for lack of formal competency
  • Excellent level of spoken and written English and Norwegian
  • Good collaboration skills and an ability to work independently and systematically
  • Ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple, and often conflicting priorities is critical
  • Problem solving skills related to functional area, understanding business impact on overall business
  • Must have demonstrated performance as a change agent with leadership and project management skills
  • Strong presentation and communication skills at all organizational levels
  • Experience with ERP and MRP systems is preferred
  • Candidates must be able to legally work and reside in Norway, without sponsorship

Your future at TechnipFMC:

  • Your journey starts with our onboarding program
  • As an international company, we provide you with great opportunities for internal growth
  • You will have the opportunity to attend development activities
  • We offer benefits, programs and the possibility to work partially from home to support your Work-Life Balance
  • We have benefits like company cabins, in-house gym, and sports teams  
  • You will be secured by good insurance and retirements plans 

 

Practicalities:

  • Application date: 6th of January 2025 , candidates will be evaluated on a continuing basis.
  • Place of work: Lysaker
  • For more information, please contact Manager Wojciech Jedrzejewski, wojciech.jedrzejewski@technipfmc.com

title: ALMOXARIFE I
description:
Missão do cargo

Recebimento, armazenamento, preservação, separação, distribuição / expedição e acuracidade de itens em estoque, no almoxarifado de consumíveis da TechnipFMC (Base Vitória), visando suprir as necessidades dos clientes internos e externos, de acordo com as solicitações de materiais, normas e procedimentos estabelecidos pela empresa.

Job Description

Receber a lista de separação, enviados pelo Assistente de Almoxarifado, via sistema, a fim de providenciar a retirada dos itens do estoque e envio as áreas solicitantes conforme as especificações dos mesmos.

Conferir os materiais comprados ou fabricados, oriundos de fornecedores, de produção ou transferências, realizando contagem no ato do recebimento, avaliando as condições do material, verificando integridade, condições de embalagem, reportando ao superior ou ao Almoxarife II, os casos de desvio, para que sejam tomadas as medidas cabíveis ao processo.

Registrar no sistema SAP (SAP IM/WM) as informações referentes às transações de entrada, saída e transferência de materiais, imputando valor, número da nota fiscal, quantidade, procedência (no caso do recebimento), a fim de controle do estoque.

Realizar corretamente a guarda dos materiais em estoque respeitando a sua classe de armazenagem definida nos requisitos de qualidade/engenharia.

Checar a saída de materiais, verificando número de ordem, quantidade, projeto, número de rastreabilidade, a fim de certificar-se de que o material corresponde o que está definido na solicitação.

Você está no perfil da vaga se:

• Ensino Médio completo ou desejável: Ensino técnico em mecânica, metalurgia, elétrica ou eletromecânica.

• Pacote office, desejável: Oracle, Power APS, Power BI.

• Perfil analítico para criticar premissas de estoque mínimo e máximo e metodologia de estocagem.

• Metrologia (trena e paquímetro, milímetro e polegada).
• Conhecimento em metodologia 5S e ferramentas Lean (A3, 4C, 3P, etc.).
• Metodologia FIFO.

• Conhecimento básico em Notas Fiscais (dados principais para conferência no recebimento).
• Conhecimento em logística e gestão de estoque.
description_translated_en: Job Mission Receiving, storing, preserving, separating, distributing/shipping, and ensuring the accuracy of inventory items in the TechnipFMC consumables warehouse (Vitória Base), aiming to meet the needs of internal and external customers, in accordance with the requests for materials, standards, and procedures established by the company. Job Description Receive the separation list sent by the Warehouse Assistant via the system in order to arrange for the removal of items from inventory and sending them to the requesting areas according to their specifications. Check purchased or manufactured materials from suppliers, production, or transfers, counting them upon receipt, evaluating the condition of the material, verifying integrity and packaging conditions, reporting any deviations to the superior or the Warehouse Manager II so that appropriate measures can be taken. Record in the SAP system (SAP IM/WM) information regarding material input, output, and transfer transactions, assigning value, invoice number, quantity, and origin (in the case of of receipt), in order to control inventory. Correctly store materials in stock, respecting their storage class defined in the quality/engineering requirements. Check the output of materials, verifying order number, quantity, project, traceability number, in order to ensure that the material corresponds to what is defined in the request. You are in the profile of the vacancy if: • Completed high school or desirable: Technical education in mechanics, metallurgy, electrical or electromechanics. • Office package, desirable: Oracle, Power APS, Power BI. • Analytical profile to criticize minimum and maximum stock assumptions and storage methodology. • Metrology (measurement tape and caliper, millimeters and inches). • Knowledge of 5S methodology and Lean tools (A3, 4C, 3P, etc.). • FIFO methodology. • Basic knowledge of Invoices (main data for checking upon receipt). • Knowledge of logistics and inventory management.
