title: Rotational Graduate
description:
Job Purpose

The TechnipFMC Employee Development Program (EDP) is a multi-year development program that provides entry-level professionals with direct experience in several different roles, setting the foundation for early career growth and development. Every six to eight months, the Rotational Employee (RE) will rotate to a different area, which could include materials planning, project scheduling, production control, risk management, and more. In each of your rotations, you will be fully integrated in the group you are supporting, working on real projects with real responsibility, building your network, and gaining a holistic understanding of the planning and execution processes at TechnipFMC.  The EDP consists of formal and on-the-job training, professional development, and built-in leadership and mentorship opportunities. We will work with you to define your rotation program. At the successful completion of your rotation program, the RE and the EDP management team will determine the RE's placement into the organization that aligns with your career goals and meets the business's needs.

Job Description

Role and responsibilities:

  • Executes project planning strategies to ensure that quality, cost-effectiveness, and schedules are maintained.
  • Participates in defining and executing strategies and activities to mitigate risk.
  • Makes sure all the information necessary for projects is available in a timely manner.
  • Supports and conducts all activities within the planning department.
  • Prepares all required documents in due time and owns first pass/first yield.
  • Interfaces with all required personnel to ensure project schedules are maintained.

 

Location

  • This role is based in Houston, Texas.

 

Work Environment:

  • Office and possible shop, field, or offshore environments. Possible exposure to hazards such as noise, heavy equipment, temperature extremes, chemicals, pressure testing, etc.
  • While working in assembly areas and field service applications. 
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

 

Physical Demands: 

  • Spends 50% of the time sitting and operating a computer or workstation. Spends 50% of the time in the shop or field environments.

You are meant for this job if:

  • Bachelor's degree with a minimum 3.0/4.0 GPA.
  • Preferred educational background in one of the following disciplines: Construction Management, Construction Science, Industrial Distribution, Manufacturing, Project Management, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or other relevant disciplines
  • Previous experience in relevant field is a plus
  • Possess the eligibility to work and remain in the United States without sponsorship
  • Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screen and background check.

title: Rental Tool Coordinator
description:
Job Purpose:

Join our One Services Tooling – Tool Pool Norway & UK team - as a new Rental Coordinator.

Currently we look for a new Rental Coordinator to strengthen our team within Rig XT & TH Tools.

We deliver Rental Tools to both national and international projects within the Subsea Service segment. Our Rental Tool Pool has wide range of tooling and systems for offshore operations such as Wellhead, Completion, Controls, Workover & Intervention.

 

We are continuously investing in new technologies and expanding our Tool Pool. We are working closely with Commercial team, Projects and our global One Services Tooling organization.   

Job Description:

  • Responsible for allocation of rental tools according to Tender & Project requirements to support TechnipFMC Subsea Installations & Life of Field operations domestic and international
  • Actively work together with Tender, One Services Tooling group & Services Lines to optimize accurate size of tool (increase utilization of tooling and decrease storage need), and identify need for new investments in tools  
  • Follow up delivering of new tooling
  • Responsible for condition of assets in tool pool to be “green-tagged”, work with Service Lines and projects to have tools ready for operations  
  • Proactively work together with other relevant departments to reduce lead time and cost for the various maintenance activities
  • Make sure tools are stored in proper conditions
  • Work on LEAN, engage in improvement projects   

You are meant for this job if you have:

  • Relevant work experience within the Energy industry preferably within XT and TH Systems  
  • Good understanding of subsea projects, including relevant equipment
  • Solid experience with SAP and good knowledge of MS office applications
  • A high degree of flexibility and a take great ownership of your work
  • Capability to work in a fast-paced business and operational environment requiring agility and high adaptability to change
  • The skills to also work independently and find your own improvement projects  
  • Capabilities for commercial mindset
  • A drive for accomplishing customer success and work as a team player
  • Focus on continuously raising standards and contribute to solving challenges
  • Data & Analytical skills (i.e SAP maintenance cost analysis)
  • Solid verbal and written communication skills (Norwegian and English)


Practicalities:

Location: Ågotnes, Bergen

Application deadline: 9th February 2025 - candidates will be evaluated on a continuing basis.

For more information please contact Øystein Berge, Manager Tool Pool Norway / UK (+47 5615 4626).

title: Finance Manager II
description:
Job Purpose

Responsible for financials and controls for inventory and assets for US Surface and NAM Subsea Projects and Subsea Services

Job Description

  • Provide guidance for inventory and fixed asset issues to a staff of 3-5 employees.
  • Align processes across multiple entities and business units.
  • Responsible for full cycle of assets, AFE routing system administration, and CAPEX reporting.
  • Conduct impairment analysis and liaise with tax, corporate accounting, internal and external auditors.
  • Partner with Inventory and Asset operations personnel; manage materials forecasting, budgeting, and actuals analysis.
  • Support inventory processes for subsea on-demand projects, PIRs, and vendor-managed inventories.
  • Review funded AFE status, current liabilities, and CIP balances; ensure proper balance sheet account statements.
  • Review and approve month-end reconciliations and quarterly schedules; develop standard Excel and PowerPoint templates for financial reviews.

You are meant for this job if:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance with at least ten years of accounting experience.
  • Strong understanding of asset and inventory accounting with four years of experience.
  • Ability to lead small and cross-functional teams in accomplishing multiple objectives.
  • Effective communication with technical accountants, auditors, and operations personnel.
  • Good understanding of Accounting and Financial theory and principles; experience with general accounting procedures and internal controls preferred.
  • Ability to simplify complex items and communicate them clearly.
  • Experience in financial statement review, consolidations, and variance analysis.
  • Advanced skills in Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Word, and experience in an MRP environment like SAP; strong written and oral communication skills.

WORK ENVIRONMENT: 

Frequent sitting, standing, bending down, and operating a computer or workstation.  May need to work flexible hours to meet the demands of the job.  Spends majority of time in a temperature controlled office environment. Travel no more than 10%.

title: VSO Deputy Execution Manager - NSA
description:
Job Purpose

The VSO Deputy Execution Manager is responsible for overseeing the execution of all project work scopes for a dedicated VSO asset, ensuring compliance with governance standards. This role involves managing a multi-disciplined team to deliver installation engineering and operations effectively and efficiently.

Job Description

  • Standardise, simplify and industrialise offshore execution of project work scopes
  • Optimise dedicated vessel operations and project installation schedules
  • Reduce schedule contingencies and conservatism through use of robust normalised timings
  • Develop and maintain a culture of continuous improvement with a strong focus on HSE / Quality
  • Develop continuous improvement ecosystem through lessons learned and other data obtained
  • Development and monitoring of VSO and Asset performance KPI’s for the dedicated asset
  • Manage assigned resource forecasting for applicable VSO personnel, minimising under utilisation
  • Support the development of global VSO resource planning
  • Utilising global engineering centres to the benefit of the Group
  • Support the preparation of functional specifications for vessel upgrades and CAPEX requirements
  • Leverage the combined Execution streams to maximise the opportunity to improve performance and efficiency

You are meant for this job if:

  • A degree qualification in a appropriate technical discipline is essential
  • Professional project management qualifications (desirable)
  • Experience managing and leading high performing teams
  • Commercial and market understanding
  • Effective decision making and influencing skills
  • Effective planning and project management skills
  • Effective management and leadership skills
  • Ability to solve problems
  • Strong communication and negotiation skills
  • Ability to collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams
  • Customer focus and relationship building

Additional Information

Required for position

  • Results orientated and completer/finisher – Ability to consistently deliver

  • Ability to empower people to take ownership for their responsibilities
  • Ability to prioritise and work within a dynamic changing environment

 

Required for future development

title: Compliance III (GJOB081003 | 13.1)
description:
Job Purpose

The primary purpose of this role is to ensure that human rights are respected and upheld throughout TechnipFMC's operations and global supply chain. The Compliance Associate will be responsible for developing and implementing robust governance frameworks, conducting human rights audits, and ensuring effective follow-up on identified issues. This role will also contribute to human rights data reporting and monitoring and support the drafting of annual sustainability reports and modern slavery statements. By collaborating with various departments, the Compliance Associate will help TechnipFMC maintain high standards of human rights and worker welfare.

Job Description

  • Support the Human Rights team in identifying, adopting and sustaining best practices, governance frameworks and continuous improvement of the Human Rights program, including standardizing and documenting processes
  • Develop strategies to mitigate human rights risk and address potential violations
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders, clients and suppliers to address human rights concerns
  • Lead or support human rights audits in accordance with established procedures and approved plans, preparing accurate and timely audit reports
  • Ensure effective follow-up and timely remediation of all non-conformities found in human rights audits
  • Support in verifying and drafting of the annual sustainability reports, Modern Slavery Statements, and any other regulatory filings as required
  • Provide expert advice and support to other departments on human rights related matters

You are meant for this job if:

  • Bachelor’s degree in social sciences, Legal, Human Rights or in related fields; Advanced degree is highly desirable
  • 3+ years of experience in the field of Social Sustainability and Human Right or an equivalent combination of relevant work experience and education. Social Compliance Auditor experience is highly valuable
  • A strong understanding of human rights standards (e.g., UN Guiding Principles on Business & Human Rights, OECD Guidelines, SA8000), and regulations like CSRD, CSDDD etc.,
  • Familiarity with human rights due diligence and worker welfare concepts, labor laws and delivering sustainability training programs
  • Excellent analytical and communication skills
  • Ability to work collaborative with diverse stakeholders

title: COORDENADOR DE PLANEJAMENTO
description:
Missão do Cargo

Responsável pela coordenação do planejamento de execução dos projetos de médio e alto valor agregado, referentes à manutenção dos Equipamentos, Ferramentas, Sistemas DPR, Riser, Sistema de controle , Cabeça de Poço e construção de sobressalentes para atendimento aos clientes nacionais e internacionais, visando à entrega dos produtos dentro dos prazos definidos e de acordo com os custos e qualidade estabelecida pela empresa.

Responde ainda, pela orientação técnica aos Analistas de Planejamento e Planejadores, contribuindo para a otimização dos processos elaborados

Descrição de Cargo

• Garantir o input das informações dos projetos no SAP, assegurando as datas de entrega, de forma manter as informações atualizadas para que os Analistas de Projetos possam manter o cliente devidamente informados;

• Garantir o pré-sequenciamento das atividades, com a utilização de relatórios específicos tirados do SAP, para garantir a realização de todo escopo de manutenção / fabricação demandado no projeto;

• Contribuir com a definição dos itens críticos do projeto, juntamente com as áreas de Engenharia e de Projetos, visando antecipar caminho critico no projeto de forma evitar futuras paralisações;

• Contribuir com a equipe de Projetos, na confecção do cronograma, fornecendo informações de forma identificar e sinalizar as prioridades e caminho crítico para entrega do equipamento na data acordada com o cliente;

• Garantir a execução do planejamento das atividades diárias do projeto, junto com a equipe, verificando o andamento dos elementos de MRP (Material Requirement Planning) relacionados ao seu projeto, para se assegurar do cumprimento do prazo de entrega do equipamento;

• Acompanhar o processo de planejamento, mantendo as datas dos elementos de acordo com o planejado, visando gerar um mínimo de mensagens de exceção no projeto, para o cumprimento das datas estabelecidas;

Você está destinado a este trabalho se:

• Ensino Superior de Engenharia de Produção, Engenharia Mecânica ou especialização na área.

• Desejável conhecimento em SAP, MS Project e/ou Primavera.

• Desejável inglês avançado.

• É necessário ter conhecimento em planejamento de execução dos projetos de médio e alto valor agregado,referentes à manutenção dos equipamentos, Ferramentas, Sistema de controle, cabeça de poço e construção de sobressalentes para atendimento aos clientes nacionais e internacionais, visando à entrega dos produtos dentro dos prazos definidos.

• É desejável conhecer rotina de planejamento de médio e longo prazo como S&OP (Sales e Operations Planning), MPS (Master Production Schedule) e CPR (Capacity Resource Planning). É desejável também conhecer processos de reparo (Revestimento, Soldagem e Usinagem) e manutenção de equipamentos submarinos.

• Local: Macaé, Rj

 

Skills

Also responsible for technical guidance to Planning Analysts and Planners, contributing to the optimization of the developed processes. It is also desirable to know repair processes (Coating, Welding and Machining) and maintenance of subsea equipment. • Location: Macaé, RJ Skills Additional Skills

title: LIDER ELETRICISTA OFFSHORE
description:
Job Purpose

Electro-Technical Officers (ETO's) on board PLSV's are in charge of monitoring all electrical and electronic equipment on board, maximizing operational safety and efficiency of the ship, and report to the Second Engineer.

An ETO work in close association with deck and engineering officers for all electrical and hydraulic technology and machinery related challenges. Safe operations and routine maintenance of the vessel’s power, propulsion, auxiliary, and other electro-mechanical and electronic systems is part of the duty and they are responsible for power generation and distribution systems and for other equipment such as lifts, reefers and electrical bus systems.

Job Description

- Make sure he/she is familiarized with machinery and mode systems so that in an emergency situation essential services may be safely and quickly restored. Additionally, he/she must fully understand procedures, policies and instructions of the company and comply with them;

- He/she must help with the research work as instructed by a senior officer;

- He/she must ensure that any information entering maintenance logs is accurate. Their notes shall include a wide scope of their work during their period on board the vessel and shall ensure all work-related manuals and drawings are kept updated;

- He/she shall notify the Chief Engineer about replacement equipment and requests from workshops;

- He/she must be fully familiarized with pertinent practice codes;

- He/she must keep the second engineer, chief engineer and chief electrician (if any) full informed on the progress of any works carried out. He/she must inform any defects or problems found in their area of responsibility

- He/she must be familiarized with the electrical plant of the unit, in particular de SCR system;

- He/she must be trained as a Person in Charge of the Permit to Work (PTW) System and isolations (Level 3).

- Know and be familiarized with the DP system and PMS of the vessel

- Be familiarized with the vessel's FMEA

You are meant for this job if:

- Technical Education in Electricity and Electronics;

- English Advanced

-  Professional registration required:

Certificate of Competence (COC) - III/6

STCW - National Seaman’s Record Book ETO

- Experience in the area 

Skills

Operations Readiness
Quality Assurance
Safety Management

Additional Skills

Mandatory:

• STCW - National CoC – III/6

• STCW - National Seaman’s Record Book ETO

• STCW - Certificate of Proficiency in Fast Rescue Boats (CERR)

• STCW – Medical First Aid A-VI/4-1 (EPSM)

• STCW - Advanced MN Fire Fighting A-VI/3 (ECIA)

• STCW – Certificate of Proficiency in Survival Craft (EESS)

• STCW - Professional Skills for Design of High Voltage Installations (HPAV2)

• STCW - Basic Safety Training VI/1 (TBS1)

 

Additional trainings:

• BOSIET/FOET – foreigner

• T- HUET / HUET Opito

title: Project Logistics Planner
description:
Job Purpose

Responsible Final Delivery of Hardware to Customer according to Project Schedule and Customer Milestones

Secure that HW Deliveries is complying with international laws and regulations, TechnipFMC standards, Quality and HSE

What we do:

Project Delivery Planning is a department dedicated to deliver Project Hardware to internal or external customers.The department ensures that all deliveries comply with international laws and regulations, TechnipFMC standards and contract requirements. We have the leading competence in  global logistics planning, execution and supervision of transport movements. We provide a detailed planning of Hardware logistics movements across Project work packages, to secure successful deliveries.

  • Organizing and lead delivery planning meetings with all involved parties including customer prior to customer delivery
  • Create and Complete Delivery Paperwork for final Transport to Customer

  • Follow-up progress and work closely with internal and external stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of Project Hardware

  • Plan and create & schedules for Hardware movements to SUT/SIT
  • Create and Complete Delivery Paperwork for Transport to test site locations.
  • Plan and coordinate shipments to Intercompany Vendors
  • Create and Complete Delivery Paperwork for final delivery and Transport to internal Vendors. 
  • Book shipment based on TechnipFMC standard shipping agreements.

You are meant for this job if:

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English

title: Rotational Graduate
description:
Job Purpose

The TechnipFMC Employee Development Program (EDP) is a multi-year development program that provides entry-level professionals with direct experience in several different roles, setting the foundation for early career growth and development. Every six to eight months, the Rotational Employee (RE) will rotate to a different area, which could include materials planning, project scheduling, production control, risk management, and more. In each of your rotations, you will be fully integrated in the group you are supporting, working on real projects with real responsibility, building your network, and gaining a holistic understanding of the planning and execution processes at TechnipFMC.  The EDP consists of formal and on-the-job training, professional development, and built-in leadership and mentorship opportunities. We will work with you to define your rotation program. At the successful completion of your rotation program, the RE and the EDP management team will determine the RE's placement into the organization that aligns with your career goals and meets the business's needs.

Job Description

Role and responsibilities:

  • Executes project planning strategies to ensure that quality, cost-effectiveness, and schedules are maintained.
  • Participates in defining and executing strategies and activities to mitigate risk.
  • Makes sure all the information necessary for projects is available in a timely manner.
  • Supports and conducts all activities within the planning department.
  • Prepares all required documents in due time and owns first pass/first yield.
  • Interfaces with all required personnel to ensure project schedules are maintained.

 

Location

  • This role is based in Houston, Texas.

 

Work Environment:

  • Office and possible shop, field, or offshore environments. Possible exposure to hazards such as noise, heavy equipment, temperature extremes, chemicals, pressure testing, etc.
  • While working in assembly areas and field service applications. 
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

 

Physical Demands: 

  • Spends 50% of the time sitting and operating a computer or workstation. Spends 50% of the time in the shop or field environments.

You are meant for this job if:

  • Bachelor's degree with a minimum 3.0/4.0 GPA.
  • Preferred educational background in one of the following disciplines: Construction Management, Construction Science, Industrial Distribution, Manufacturing, Project Management, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or other relevant disciplines
  • Previous experience in relevant field is a plus
  • Possess the eligibility to work and remain in the United States without sponsorship
  • Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screen and background check.

Skills

Project Execution
Communication Management
Cost/Financial Management
Project Governance
Project Management

Leadership Competencies

Adopt a Growth Mindset
Create Inclusive Culture
Drive Accountability
Problem Solving

title: Project Manager
description:
Job Purpose

As Project Manager you are overall responsible for the execution of all work related to dedicated project scope within XT Service Line. This includes preparations and execution of maintenance performed by TechnipFMC and Subcontractors.

You will be a trusted leader of a multidisciplinary project team, securing your results through great teamwork with a strong focus on HSE, Quality, Cost and Delivery.

As Project Manager you are the single point of contact towards the client for assigned scope and Purchase Orders.

 

 

Bergen Base - office location: Ågotnes, Vestland, Norway.

 

Feel free to reach out to Hiring Manager, Wilhelm Martin Monsen (Manager XT Services), or our Recruiter, Helene Olav, directly for any questions you might have:

 

Wilhelm Martin Monsen
Phone: +47 920 33 831
Email: wilhelm.monsen@technipfmc.com

 

Helene Olav
Phone: +47 67 20 24 10
Email: helene.olav@technipfmc.com

 

Application deadline: 16.12.2024

Job Description

As Project Manager you are responsible for the day-to-day management of your dedicated Project Team such as

 

  • The overall financials within the project, maximizing gross margin without compromising on HSE or Quality
  • Organize and control CTR process towards support resources delivering quotes to Customer within defined timeline 
  • Cost control and corrective actions if required
  • Proactively contribute to inbound sales and actively identify opportunities in collaboration with Sales & Marketing
  • Ensure that all activities are planned, managed and coordinated in accordance with contract documents, client call-off, TFMC specifications, procedures and processes
  • Coordinate and optimize project efficiency, reporting, forecast and quotation
  • Performance within your dedicated service line

You are meant for this job if:

  • You have a relevant degree, Bachelor level (relevant experience may compensate for lack of formal education)

  • In-dept knowledge about Equinor subsea equipment portfolio is an advantage

  • You continuously raise standards, are innovative and solution-oriented
  • You are committed and proactive, have a strong sense of collaboration among your team and across functions
  • You have the ability to prioritize and execute tasks systematically

title: Subsea Services Engineer
description:
Job Purpose

In the TechnipFMC Subsea Services (Drilling Products Value Stream), we create unique value in the subsea wellhead market by developing and supporting innovative solutions to solve the most difficult challenges. Projects range from conceptual development and validation, stages of prototyping to reduce manufacturing, installation risk, and industrialization of new solutions. We are looking for an engineer with a focus on detailed mechanical design who can join our Drilling Products team in Subsea Services Engineering Department, a part of Global Engineering Center located in Kraków

Job Description

  • Developing new designs as well as design improvements of Operational Equipment, Tools, and Test Equipment for the subsea drilling product line
  • Creating, updating and reviewing instructions supporting equipment assembly, testing, maintenance, and offshore installations
  • Creating, updating and reviewing designs, drawings, part reports, specifications, etc. Ensuring that products meet specifications, standards, and performance requirements within area of expertise
  • Performing hand-calculations to support design work
  • Presenting to customers and multi-disciplined audiences, conducting design discussion meetings
  • Providing engineering support during processes of procurement, production, assembly and testing of equipment
  • Working independently on and/or leading design projects
  • Preparing accurate CTR (cost, time and resource) estimates for projects
  • Tracking spends, budget and forecasted costs for personal projects and checking in with supervisor to discuss project status and decisions

You are meant for this job if:

  • Master's or Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Machine Design or other related field
  • +3 years of professional experience - Mechanical Engineer
  • Experience in 3D CAD Software is required
  • Focus on detailed mechanical design and demonstrated ability to apply engineering practices, design methods & calculations
  • Very good problem solving and troubleshooting skills
  • Ability to read, interpret and prepare technical designs and documentation
  • Ability to effectively operate in the project team environment
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Presentation skills
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate in English, orally and through written documentation
  • Willingness to travel occasionally

Additional Skills

  • Experience in PLM Software (ie. Teamcenter, SAP) would be a plus
  • Oil and Gas Industry experience would be a plus

title: ESG Sourcing & Procurement Lead
description:
Job Purpose

This role contributes to the overall Sourcing and Procurement activities associated to Environment, Social and Governance (ESG).  Three primary pillars are Carbon Footprint, Supplier Diversity and Human Rights

Job Description

 

  • Leading/managing deliverables assigned for ESG supply chain initiatives within the three primary pillars, globally across all TechnipFMC locations.
  • Engaging and liaising with clients, industry bodies, internal and external stakeholders in aspects of supplier facing ESG discussions.
  • Staying abreast of ESG and sustainability regulations and implementing best practices for compliance.
  • Contributing to program and system development according to the company’s drive for simplification, standardization, and industrialization, including as it relates to company policies, procedures, processes, and digital tools.
  • Identifying ESG related risks and opportunities within the global supply chain and delivering strategies to mitigate risks and capitalize on opportunities.
  • Managing performance of goals set to reduce environmental impact, enhance social responsibility, and improve overall efficiency and sustainability across the supply chain.
  • Achieving programmatic effectiveness, efficiency, and success by acting as an ESG subject matter expert for the company, developing informational material and providing training to relevant internal stakeholders.

 

You are meant for this job if:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Supply Chain, Sustainability or related field.
  • 3-5 years of related work experience.
  • Knowledge of, and experience with prevailing ESG regulations.
  • Understanding of ESG frameworks, standards and reporting requirements, such as CSRD, ISSB, GRI, GHG Protocol, among others.
  • Understanding of oilfield services and/or manufacturing business operations
  • Ability to independently analyze data and conduct data assessments.
  • Expertise in developing, processing, and presenting data of all kinds.
  • Advanced Microsoft Office skills.
  • Ability to work independently, handle multiple tasks and changing priorities in a fast-paced environment and take initiative to address/mitigate risks.
  • Soft Skills: Strength in collaboration with multi-functional teams and excellent communication skills; analytical mindset with close attention to detail; people engagement with a motivating style; creative thinker; improvement driven; problem solver.

title: Software Product Owner
description:
Job Purpose

The Digital Product Owner (PO) is an integral member of the Agile Team, responsible for managing the Product Backlog at the "User Story" level. The PO translates feature requirements into clear, actionable language for the development team, ensuring quick interpretation and conversion into development tasks. The PO ensures the predictability and quality of delivery, and gathers necessary user feedback before proposing the release of features.

Current Assignment: Subsea Service Business Unit, TechnipFMC

This role is within the fast-paced Subsea Service Business Unit of TechnipFMC, which is characterized by high technology content and strong customer-facing elements. The PO will manage a backlog of work related to:

  • Contextualizing ERP (SAP), PLM (TeamCenter), and CRM (SalesForce) data.
  • Accelerate quotation contributing to the development of our internal webapp. 
  • Support the birth of our Remote Operation Center, including the development of our WebApp enabling live Video and Audio Streaming with live could storage. 
  • Contribute to our first step using AI and GenAI to accelerate our processes. 
 

Job Description

• The Product Owner is responsible for defining stories and to help prioritize the team backlog to streamline the execution of program priorities while maintaining the functional and technical integrity of the features or components. 
• Heavily involved in backlog refinement and preparation and execution of planning Events. 
• Contributes to product and program vision, roadmap, and content presentations.
• With input from the Product Manager, Business Owners, EPIC Owner, software engineers and other stakeholders, the PO has the primary responsibility for building, editing, and maintaining the team backlog. Owns the team backlog. 
• Just-in-time story elaboration of user stories for implementation. Collaborates with their team to detail stories with acceptance criteria and examples in the form of acceptance tests
• Works with the team to agree and accept story completion. Validates story acceptance criteria, acceptance tests, and definition of Done (DoD). Assures the level of quality and fitness for use.
• Collaborates with their team and any other stakeholders in the team demo. 
• Participates in the Iteration Retrospective, where the teams gather to improve their processes
• The PO works across teams to define and implement improvement stories that will increase the velocity and quality of the products or programs.

 

You are meant for this job if:

• Autonomy: Works under general direction. Receives specific direction, accepts guidance and has work reviewed at agreed milestones. Uses discretion in identifying and responding to complex issues related to own assignments. Determines when issues should be escalated to a higher level. Plans and monitors own work (and that of others where applicable) competently within limited deadlines.

• Influence: Interacts with and influences colleagues. May oversee others or make decisions which impact routine work assigned to individuals or stages of projects. Has working level contact with customers, suppliers and partners. Understands and collaborates on the analysis of user/customer needs and represents this in their work. Contributes fully to the work of teams by appreciating how own role relates to other roles.

• Complexity: Performs a range of work, sometimes complex and non-routine, in a variety of environments. Applies a methodical approach to routine and moderately complex issue definition and resolution. Applies and contributes to creative thinking or finds new ways to complete tasks.

title: HSES Methods Relative
description:
Job Purpose

Acompanhar a identificação de perigos e avaliação dos riscos, realizar inspeções nas áreas de trabalho, participar da elaboração de procedimentos técnico-operacionais na área de HSE, instruir funcionários sobre a política, ferramentas, pratica e procedimentos de prevenção de HSE.

Job Description

Executar atividades de HSE (Saúde, Segurança do Trabalho e Meio Ambiente) da Empresa ou de um projeto específico, baseando-se nas políticas e regras Corporativas do Grupo que versam sobre a matéria, bem como, nas normas ISO 14001 e ISO 45001, tais como: suporte na identificação de requisitos legais aplicados e no seu cumprimento, realização de inspeções de HSE, acompanhamento de auditorias de HSE, emissão de relatórios técnicos, realização de medições ambientais, ; emissão/ análise/ acompanhamento dos RASI´s; acompanhamento de brigada de incêndio e CIPA; 

Investigação de incidentes (aplicando Técnica TOP SET); atualização de relatórios estatísticos, promoção das ferramentas de HSE e disseminação das práticas de HSE para colaboradores e contratados, visando assegurar o atendimento às necessidades do cliente e do Grupo em conformidade com os preceitos legais exigidos; 


Acompanhar a identificação de perigos e avaliação dos riscos juntamente com a área envolvida, apontando medidas de controle para eliminação / minimização dos perigos; 

Participar de reuniões com colaboradores e contratadas, discutindo eventuais acidentes, não conformidades ocorridas, RASI´s, ferramentas de HSE, requisitos legais a serem cumpridos, bem como propostas de melhorias nas áreas de trabalho, a fim de conscientizar e possibilitar o atendimento às necessidades do cliente, legislação aplicável e normas do Grupo, participar e controlar as MOCs (gestão de mudanças) 

Ministrar treinamentos com base na política, nos procedimentos de HSE e em requisitos legais, transmitindo informações inerentes ao sistema de HSE aplicado em projetos e sites do Grupo, bem como, difundindo conceitos e ferramentas de HSE, visando a conscientização dos colaboradores e/ ou contratados; 

Imputar dados nos bancos de dados de HSE (SYNERGI, Oportunidades de Melhoria, etc), assim como encaminhar e acompanhar o andamento dos mesmos, sob supervisão, a fim de subsidiar o Supervisor, Engenheiro e/ ou Coordenador de HSE com informações necessárias para relatórios estatísticos, tratamento das ações corretivas/ preventivas e análise crítica do Sistema de Gestão de HSE; 

Responder pela própria segurança e demais na área e otimização dos recursos disponíveis (humanos e equipamentos) e estar integrado ao programa QHSE.
 

You are meant for this job if:

Técnico em Segurança do Trabalho completo

Providing training based on HSE policy, procedures, and legal requirements, conveying information inherent to the HSE system applied in Group projects and sites, as well as disseminating HSE concepts and tools to raise awareness among employees and/or contractors. title: Value Stream Project Manager
description:
Job Purpose

The primary purpose of this role is to establish and manage an optimized value stream focused on reducing cost and lead-time of the MPM Product and improve the schedule predictability to thebusiness. Eliminating waste in all aspects of the current delivery and product performance.

Job Description

  •  Leads a multi-disciplinary project team to achieve readiness levels targets.
  •  Responsible to define and accomplish product cost and lead time targets.
  •  Work hand in hand with the technical product lead to define product family and strategic roadmap
  •  Builds and maintains relationship with customer and other stakeholders associated with the Products (partners, subcontractors, vendors...).
  •  Maintaining value stream maps - conduct fact base analysis of current state maps and communicate expected future state map.
  •  Lead impact assessment and implementation of market driven MOC’s - using trade-offs data to make decisions.
  •  Manage plan and lead implementation to achieve future state map in accordance with product targets. Communicate normal from abnormal for execution readiness as development concludes and product matures.
  •  Enforce CTO Requirements & Governance for product.
  • Host cross-functional obeya to ensure CTO Execution readiness - leading day to day activities to ensure commitments are achieved.

You are meant for this job if:

  • Engineering degree or equivalent diploma
  • 7+ years of experience in Engineering, Scheduling, Procurement, Planning, cost or Quality Assurance plus six to eight years' experience in a Project Supervisor/Management function
  • Certification, MBA or equivalent business experience.
  • Project Management / MRP systems
  • Must demonstrate a thorough understanding of Project Management techniques and standards.

Additional Skills

  • Demonstrates effective leadership ability within a matrixed team environment and contributes significantly to team performance.
  • Demonstrates exceptional negotiation, planning, interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Leadership and Team Building experience with the ability to motivate a diverse group of people to successfully complete team objectives
  • Demonstrated effectiveness in project negotiations, multi-site interfaces and commercial management of contracts, supplier quality systems and development and implementation of project management strategies.
  • Intercultural awareness

Your future at TechnipFMC:

  • Your journey starts with our onboarding program
  • As an international company, we provide you with great opportunities for internal growth
  • You will have the opportunity to attend development activities
  • We offer benefits, programs and the possibility to work partially from home to support your Work-Life Balance
  • We have benefits like company cabins, in-house gym, and sports teams
  • You will be secured by good insurance and retirements plans
  • Collaborative and innovative atmosphere that promotes teamwork

title: Project Manager I R (GJOB104001 | 13.2)
description:
Job Purpose

The primary purpose of this role is to establish and manage costs and lead-time of the entire product line, working in a multidisciplinary manner with different functions - engineering, manufacturing, supply chain and services. Lead initiatives for product improvements that help reducing both cost and lead time and support the value stream to increasing readiness level across different disciplines.es

Job Description

•    Track Cost/LT performance in the WC product line on the system level;
•    Track Cost/LT at PN level with each value stream;
•    Development, maintenance, and improvement of the WC cost book process;
•    Map opportunities and improvements with categories & engineering teams;
•    Generate management data on the performance of product cost and PNs over time as well as maintenance of L1 and L2 KPI’s;
•    Perform Tender vs. execution comparisons and improve processes and cost references;
•    Annual cost target development working with value stream manager and product marketing;
•    Support Tender reviews;
•    Host Feedback meetings between execution/project and tender. Collect, prioritize, and implement value stream driven feedback;

title: TEC MANUT GUINDASTE OFFSHORE III
description:
Job Purpose

The crane technician is responsible for the operational support, maintenance and repair of this equipment, and other auxiliary systems installed on their marine unit or allocation project. Their qualifications and experience must be focused on working in the fields of crane mechanics and hydraulics, but it is also relevant to be able to support investigations in the disciplines of electrics and instrumentation applied to cranes.

 

When on a marine unit, this professional must report directly to the chief engineer. Their duties include: managing and carrying out preventive and corrective maintenance, managing the repairs carried out and managing the spare parts required. The maintenance schedule must be approved by the machine manager, and the technician is not authorized to carry out any intervention while the equipment is in operation.

 

When working on a project or maintenance period, the crane technician must report directly to the manager responsible for the activity linked to this equipment.

Job Description

- Responsible for the maintenance, fault identification and repair of any installed cranes;

- Performing safely and efficiently any task directed by the chief engineer;

- Familiarize themselves with the equipment under their responsibility in the hydraulic/mechanical/electrical and instrumentation disciplines. Their understanding must be broad and applied under the guidance of the company's procedures, policies and instructions;

- Support any technical design activity required by the machine manager;

- Support any specialist technicians on board as required, but only under the direct instruction of the chief engineer;

- Ensure that all maintenance data and applicable service tickets are recorded accurately and comprehensibly. Also ensure that manuals and diagrams are kept up to date. Service ticket notes must contain sufficient detail to be a record of your activity history with the vessel;

- Keep the chief engineer informed of the progress of any work being carried out. In the event of any faults or problems causing disruption to the operation, the chief engineer must be involved immediately;

- Ensure that during the course of their work the equipment in their area is operational, maintained and legally compliant for operation;

- Review reports and checklists from crane operators and evaluate the information received. Intervention recommendations should be reported to the chief engineer;

- Comply with the T-MOS management system.

You are meant for this job if:

- Technical Education in Electromechanics, Automation, Industrial Mechanics;

- Professional registration required: CFT active;

- Experience in the position required;

- English Advanced

Skills

Equipment Knowledge
Quality Assurance
Troubleshooting

Additional Skills

 

Mandatory:

Experience in inspection/maintenance of cranes, hydraulic, automation and mechanical systems.

Experience as a field technician specializing in cranes;

Experience as a crane manufacturer's representative or technician;

Experience in FAT, SAT, commissioning and technical investigations.

 

Additional Training:

Maintenance of hydraulic components such as: hydraulic piston pumps, hydraulic motors, design and fabrication of rigid lines, design and fabrication of hoses, dimensional inspection of steel cables. CBSP - Basic Safety Course on Platform T-HUET / HUET OPITO - Helicopter Escape Training

title: TEC INSTRUMENTACAO OFFSHORE III
description:
Job Purpose

Instrumentation Technician (TI) on board PLSV's reports to the Chief Engineer and works with a wide variety of devices to measure and control pressure, flow, temperature, level, motion, force, and chemical make up.

Job Description

- Inspects, tests, adjusts, and repairs electric, electronic, mechanical, and pneumatic instruments and systems used to indicate, record, and control generating operations in conventional or nuclear power electric generating plant: Inspects meters, indicators, and gauges to detect abnormal fluctuations.

- Tests accuracy of flowmeters, pressure gauges, temperature indicators, controllers, radiation counters or detectors, and other recording, indicating or controlling instruments to locate defective components in system, using test equipment, such as pressure gauges, mercury manometers, potentiometers, pulse and signal generators, oscilloscopes, transistor curve tracers, and ammeters, voltmeters, and wattmeters.

- Traces out and tests electronic solid state and vacuum tube circuitry and components to locate defective parts in analog and digital, protection, or radiation monitoring systems, using test equipment, schematics, and maintenance manuals.

- Removes defective instruments from system, decontaminates, disassembles, and cleans instruments, and replaces defective parts, using hand tools.

- Reassembles instruments and replaces instruments in system, using hand tools.

- Lubricates instruments and replaces defective wiring and tubing.

- Calibrates readings on instruments according to standards and adjusts phasing and aligns stages to ensure accuracy of recording and indicating function.

- Records calibrations made, parts and components used, and inventory of parts on hand.

- Prepares schematic drawings, sketches, and reports to reflect changes or alterations made in instruments, circuits, and systems.

- May be designated according to type power plant as Nuclear-Plant-Instrument Technician; Instrument Repairer, Steam Plant.

You are meant for this job if:

- Technical Education in Electrotechnics, Electronics, Information technology and Control Automation;

- Experience in the area;

- English Advanced;

title: Senior Design Engineer 1
description:
Your Responsibilities

You will be part of an international team of experts developing products and services from concept to operations and work closely with our Service Centers to improve continuously.

  • Designing subsea equipment for oil & gas industry from concept phase through releasing it for manufacturing & providing life of field support.
  • Designing products in accordance with design specifications and engineering standards.
  • Cooperating within the Value Stream Engineering team,   with project teams, Service Sites, and other cross-functions teams.
  • Taking responsibility for product documentation required for procurement, fabrication, testing including:
    • Product quality requirements,
    • 3D models, drawings and layouts of single components, assemblies & systems,
    • Verification of design using classical analysis techniques and/or FEA,
    • Assembly, test & maintenance documentation,
  • Creating & maintaining user/engineering/service documentation.
  • Performing Product Design Reviews and Risk Assessments.
  • Executing work in order to deliver the design in compliance with requirements, within baseline dates and budgets.
  • Participating in technical meetings with other TechnipFMC Product Groups, Operations, Service Sites, Suppliers and Customers.
  • Defining assembly, disassembly and test requirements.

You are meant for this job if:

  • BA/MA degree in Engineering (preferably Mechanics, Machine Design, Mechanical Engineering or similar).
  • Minimum 4 years of experience in Product Design & Development.
  • You have the desire to work in a Multicultural and multi-functional team.
  • Good communication skills to discuss aspects of the design with stakeholders and lead design reviews.
  • You are proactive and able to identify and define your tasks.
  • You are flexible concerning job tasks and adapt well to changes.
  • Ability to work in challenging project environment, problem solving skills, accountability.
  • Experience in CAD software (creating models, drawings, assemblies, geometric dimensioning and tolerancing).
  • Knowledge of manufacturing processes.
  • Fluent English & Polish.

We offer:

  • An informal and stimulating work environment with a high professional standard.
  • Career and personal development opportunities in an international team.
  • Demanding and enjoyable teamwork and cooperation with technology partners and customers worldwide.
  • Competitive salary and a package of benefits.
  • Relocation package if applicable

title: SDS Rental Planner
description:

TechnipFMC is committed to driving real change in the energy industry. Our ambition is to build a sustainable future through relentless innovation and global collaboration – and we want you to be part of it. Bring your unique energy to our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide, and discover a rewarding, fulfilling, and varied career that you can take in anywhere you want to go.

title: Full Stack Software Developer 1
description:
We are looking for a Full Stack Software Developer!

TechnipFMC is a dynamic and innovative energy provider that is leading the way in developing cutting-edge technology solutions for the energy industry. Our mission is to create sustainable and efficient solutions that benefit our planet and help us stay ahead of the curve in a rapidly evolving industry. We are currently seeking a Full-Stack Developer to join our team and help us continue to push the boundaries of what is possible.

Job Description

•    Design, develop, and maintain backend and frontend applications.
•    Create and manage databases using PostgreSql.
•    Develop and maintain frontend applications using TypeScript, React/Angular, Material Design, and Apollo.
•    Write end-to-end tests using Cypress/Playwright.
•    Manage code repositories using Bitbucket and GitHub Actions.
•    Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines using CircleCi and GitHub Actions.
•    Deploy applications to AWS.
•    Work in a "you-build-it-you-run-it" mentality.
•    Work on sustainable and efficient solutions to reduce our carbon footprint in the gas and oil industry.
•    Work in globally distributed teams.
•    Look with your feet. Go and see. Travel if needed.

Your are meant for this job if:

•    Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.
•    Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Full-Stack Developer.
•    Strong understanding of Java/Kotlin, Spring Boot, Spring Data, GraphQL, TypeScript, React/Angular, Material Design, and PostgreSql.
•    Experience with end-to-end testing using Cypress.
•    Experience with code repositories such as Bitbucket and GitHub Actions.
•    Experience with pipeline tools such as CircleCi and GitHub Actions.
•    Experience with AWS deployment.
•    Experience with task management tools such as Jira.
•    Experience with documentation tools such as Confluence.
•    Familiarity with IntelliJ and VisualStudio.
•    Interest in sustainable and efficient solutions for reducing carbon footprint in the gas and oil industry.

Your future at TechnipFMC

  • Exciting global environment
  • Engaging tasks and work-life balance
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • State of the art development environment
  • Training and carrier development opportunities
  • Good insurance and pension plans

Practicalities

title: New Product Development Engineer
description:
Job Purpose

The purpose of the Well & Flow Control New Product Development team is to develop products and sub-systems that solidify TechnipFMC's leadership in the subsea market. Projects range from front end support, conceptual development and validation, stages of prototyping to reduce manufacturing, installation and intervention risk, and industrialization of new solutions.

Job Description

  • Engineering development of new well & flow control products with include valves, connectors, tree systems, tooling, and instrumentation.
  • Enabling differentiation of TechnipFMC products to capture broader markets and continuously validating product roadmaps for value proposition of developments.
  • Expand the features, capacities, and performance on mature products to enable a broader range of service conditions and respond to market/industry feedback.
  • Innovatively work alongside the Rapid Design Center (RDC) for prototyping during various stages of the development. 
  • Engage with the entire value stream to ensure effective cost, manufacturing and operation.
  • Enable patented technology to support market leadership.
  • Build configurable product architecture to enable pre-designed customer configuration and effective industrialized solutions.
  • Leverage LEAN design methods for concept papers, design decisions, and value stream readiness.

You are meant for this job if:

  • BS Degree in Engineering or applicable discipline with 2 to 4 years of related experience.
  • General understanding of economic factors (cost, profit, impact of decisions) affecting product developments.  
  • Good knowledge of manufacturing, assembly, qualification and test processes. 
  • Working knowledge of API 6A/17D is preferred. 
  • Sound understanding of Engineering practices, design methods & calculations.  
  • Ability to read, interpret and prepare applicable technical information and suggest design or process changes to ensure functional and cost effective results.

title: ENGENHEIRO DUTOS RIGIDOS SR
description:
Job Purpose

Provides technically complex engineering solutions in particularly challenging project environments in accordance with TechnipFMC standards, procedures and processes, schedules and budget, with a continuous concern for quality, targets, and customer satisfaction.

Job Description

  • Prepare and review engineering Design Basis, Technical Specifications, Philosophies, In-Place and As-Laid/As-Built Analysis and other documentation as required to support different phases of the project, namely: conceptual, FEED and detailed design of the rigid pipelines scope.
  • Produce engineering reports and calculations to support different phases of the project, namely: conceptual, FEED and detailed design analysis.
  • Verification and validation of technical reports against international standards, codes, TFMC internal guidelines and best engineering practices.
  • Ensure quality of deliverables through systematic verification according to TFMC engineering process.
  • Attend and participate in internal meetings, project meetings and client meetings when required.
  • Interface with TechnipFMC disciplines as required for the rigid design scope.
  • Completes assigned work within the allocated schedule and budget while maintaining company quality and safety standards. 
  • Ensures assigned work is compliant with corporate standards, client requirements, government regulations and industry standards.
  • Ensure designs and analyses are performed in compliance with the established latest design rules and procedures within the Technip Group.
  • Ensure technical integrity and timeliness of all designs undertaken for tenders and projects within their scope of work
  • Participate in design control and operability meetings as appropriate e.g., Design Reviews, Lessons Learned etc.
  • Ensure compliance with Technip Quality and HSE policies and procedures.
  • Familiarization with all contract documents and requirements.
  • Understanding of basic project management concepts.
  • Support the technical development of the less experience engineers within the rigid pipeline team.
  • Support internal training and capacitation of less experience engineers within the rigid pipeline team.

Location:

  • Eco Sapucaí - Rio de Janeiro

You are meant for this job if:

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering (Civil, Structural, Mechanical, Naval or Aeronautical).
  • Master’s degree in Engineering (desired but not mandatory).
  • Doctoral’s degree in Engineering (desired but not mandatory).
  • Experience in the offshore Oil and Gas industry/ Subsea.
  • General understanding of SURF infrastructure.
  • General awareness of standards and regulations such as API and DNV.  Ability to research and apply the required codes to given areas as needed.
  • Experience undertaking the design and advanced structural analyses for engineering in general.
  • Experience undertaking the design and analysis of subsea rigid pipelines (desired but not mandatory).
  • Experience in FE analysis (desired ABAQUS, but not required) and FEM knowledge.
  • Proven ability with MathCAD and programing language (i.e.: python and VBA).
  • Previous knowledge with AutoCAD, SAGE 3D Profile (desired, not required), ABAQUS (desired but not required), PRCI AGA (desired but not required), DNV Fat FREE (desired but not required) and etc.
  • Full command of the English Language.

  • Ability to handle fast pace, high demand environments with stress management skills
  • Strong planning, organizational and time management skills. It is required ability to work within tight deadlines
